She would always dribble the rubber sphere to see how long she could keep it up, she did all sorts of tricks with it.
But on that day, she made a mistake and dropped it and it rolled out onto the middle of the road.
Though her father and uncle Qrow had told her many times to look both ways before crossing any street, such thoughts had completely fled her young mind, she was too concerned with getting her ball back to care.
The little girl ran out onto the street and chased the runaway ball down.
When she finally caught it, she was filled with a sense of relief and joy.

What happened next would forever be burned into Ruby's memory.

Just as the child went to return to the playground, a car horn blared loudly and she turned to see where it came from.
A Truck, a blue one to be exact, was barreling towards her at high speeds.
She was like a deer in headlights, the mortal terror that she experienced in that moment paralyzed her and robbed her of any decisiveness.
Ruby recalled that right before the truck hit her, one thought had made its way into her mind.

She had to get out of the way.


The very next moment she found herself back on the playground watching as the truck crashed into a nearby gas station.
Ruby was visibly shaken by the entire ordeal, having narrowly avoided death.
But more importantly she was very confused by these turn of events.
When and how did she move to this spot?
It was later that day that she learned that the driver had suffered a stroke while driving on the road home from work and fell into a coma.
Her family had fused over her for hours when they heard the news but she didn't really pay them any mind, her thoughts were on the mysterious circumstances of her narrow escape.
A full week had passed with nothing else of note occurring and the events of the car crash already fading from everyone's memory.
It was a sweltering summer morning that day and Ruby was sitting on a bench somewhere in the local park pondering on how she seemed to mysteriously teleport to safety before she was hit while the rest of her family was doing their own thing.
At this point the little girl was feeling unbearably hot, she felt as though she would drown in her own sweat.
She heard the sound of an ice-cream truck driving by with its iconic jingle ringing in the air.
She could've gone for some ice-cream right then but she didn't have any money and she couldn't ask her father or uncle to buy her some
Because she had recently gone to the dentist to have a cavity filled.
Ruby watched the truck longingly as all of the other kids had ice cream served to them.

What she wouldn't do for a cone right about now.

She then felt something cold and wet on her skin.

In her hands was an ice-cream cone with three scoops of cookie dough ice-cream, her favorite.
The child dropped the cone out of fright.
As she watched the frozen treat melt away on the asphalt walk way, she felt her confusion and fear from the car crash return ten fold!

What was happening to her?

She was determined to find out.

Later that day, Ruby had been combing through her memories trying find some pattern , some correlation between what happened today and what happened last week but couldn't think of anything .
It was so frustrating!
The little girl was practically tearing her hair out trying to solve this puzzle and giving herself a headache in the process.
None it made any sense!
There didn't seem to be any connection.
The only thing that came close was the fact both time she wished for something to happen.
Ruby paused in her train off thought.
It couldn't be. There was no way.
Could it?
Ruby put both hands out in front her and began thinking about her favorite snack.
Almost immediately a jar of freshly baked cookies materialized in her hands without any fanfare.
The little girl’s breath caught in her throat.
She took one of the warm gooey treats and took an experimental bite.
it's just like what mom used to make.
The revelation of what she just discovered blew her young mind.
She was the cause of those bizarre occurrences. But how?
Her mind went back a week before the crash. She was being trained by her uncle Qrow in the ways of hunters and had just learned how to unlock her aura.
This could only mean one thing.
These weird events, this power, was her semblance.
The largest of smiles appeared on the little girl's face.
She had her semblance! And it was a cool one too!
She would spend the next few hours testing out her newly discovered semblance before showing it off to her family.
Her family responded with mixed reactions.
Her sister Yang thought that her semblance was really cool and started asking her to make all kinds of things. Her father and uncle on the other hand shared a look of concern with each other, never before in all of mankind's recorded history has a semblance of such power and potential ever manifested before.
The two of them would sit young Ruby down and give her a very serious discussion about responsibility and wisdom, though most of it would go over her head, she was too busy basking in the awesomeness that was her semblance.
If only she had listened to them back then. Then perhaps she could have saved herself from a lifetime of heartache.
Over the weeks that passed after discovering her semblance , Ruby recalled, to her eternal shame, that she had started to become more spoiled and more arrogant as the days went by.
She would use her powers to always get what she wanted whenever she wanted it, and the things she wanted slowly became bigger and more extravagant than the last.
At some point she even began to pass the time by playing pranks on people.
They started innocently enough but as time went by her mischief became meaner and more cruel.
It all came to a head once when her sister Yang confronted her about it.
Ruby couldn't remember the details of the argument but it had something to do with Ruby playing a very mean spirited joke on one of her classmates.
This back and forth went on for thirty minutes, with yang call her out for being a jerk and Ruby dismissing her concerns.
Eventually, Yang had had enough of Ruby's nonsense and actually punched her in the face!
Enraged, Ruby shouted at her sister for her to go away.
And then she was gone.
Ruby's eyes went wide with horror.
She ran downstairs to her father and uncle to tell them what happened and to get their aid.
Her father and uncle gave her an incredulous look and asked her who this “Yang" person was.
A weight as heavy as lead fell into the pit of her stomach.
She up to her room and looked through all of the photographs she possessed to look for any sign of her sister's existence.
There was nothing.
She was gone, erased.
She "went away".
The scarlet girl's eyes filled with tears and she cried a loud sorrowful cry
Guilt wrapped around her soul like a noose, sucking away any good in her life.
She didn't care about the toys or the pranks or even that Yang punched her.
She just wanted her sister back.
“ Ruby?”
The scarlet child's head shot up and she turned to see the source of the voice.
It was her sister, alive and well!
“Is something wrong Rubes?" The wild haired child said in concern.
Large fat tears welled up in the scarlet child's eyes.
She ran towards her big sister and embraced her, an endless deluge of apologies from her mouth as she sobbed into her sister's shirt.

That was the last time she had ever used her semblance, until today that is.
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: Ruby almighty!

choices: Ruby decides to her physical might without restraint!
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.content:
A deep frown appeared on the young woman's face.
Ever since that day she had lived in of her semblance as well as her self.
She feared that she might break something or that she might become a monster if she used her true strength.
And thus, Ruby spent the last ten plus years of her life constantly managing all of her reactions and suppressing her feelings and constantly guarding against every single thought that could even be remotely construed as self serving or “evil”.
All these years she had been denying a fundamental aspect of everything that made her who she was.
Her semblance was a part of her, in fact, by definition it was her.
But no more!
No longer would she let the mistakes of the past dominate her life. No longer will she live in fear of herself!
From now on she would not hold herself back.

The crimson Titaness shot up from her bed with a bright smile on her face and a fire in her belly, inadvertently causing a rather strong earthquake to shake the school so hard it actually compromised the campus's infrastructure.
She was going to unleash her power to the fullest!
But now she was confronted with a new dilemma.
How exactly would she go about doing this?
Though the young woman was determined to go through with this idea, she didn't want to do anything that would hurt anyone.
She racked her brain for a solution.
If only there was a place where she could go all out without worrying about her surroundings.
It was then that a wicked idea came to her.
She stomped over to her to her closet and placed her hand on the door.
She focused her semblance for a few seconds before stopping and opening it.
The space within the closet had been extended into a vast corridor that seemed to stretch for miles, her clothes lined the walls of the vast hallway, some of them were identical copies of her usual attire while every now and then a unique design would pop up.
Ruby smiled at her handy work and stepped inside to begin her journey, making sure to close the door behind her before she left.

The young woman had spent the better part of three hours walking down this dimly lit corridor and hadn't gotten any closer than when she started.
Perhaps she over did it a bit with the whole “fantastical passage way hidden inside a closet” idea.
Ruby shrugged to herself and continued walking forwards with purpose.
The titanic huntress stopped in her tracks when a thought occurred to he.
couldn't she just make herself appear at the end?
The silver eyed huntress giggled at her own silliness and upon her semblance.
The next thing she knew she was standing in front of a wooden door.
Ruby let out a happy tune and opened it.
Inside was a space identical to the interior of her closet before the change except that it was remade to be large enough to fit Ruby’s entire body.
The space inside was quite claustrophobic, by Gigant standards at least, and literally only had enough space inside for her to stand up.
But that was ok, she had planned for it to be this way.
She closed her eyes and focused on her semblance.
When she next opened them the space had grown to the size of the dorm room.
Nice.
She used her semblance again and the room had grown to the size of the campus and after that
Three times as big.
Ruby floated in the air, having made the room expand away from her.
The Crimson giantess looked at what she'd done so far and give it an appreciative nod.
That was a good warm up.
Now it was time to get really started.
The red Gigant then sped up the rate of expansion by a vast margin, the room grew until it matched the size of the city and then beyond!
And she was far from done.
It grew until it rivaled the area of vale, then the continent of solitas, until encompassed the entirety of Remnant .
She still wasn't satisfied. It was time to take it to second gear!
She made the dimensions of the room until rivaled the sun, the solar system, the entire galaxy and then beyond, each time the process sped up just a little bit more.
Eventually, she stopped and appraised her work so far.
She found herself self floating in an empty black void that stretched on for eternity in all directions.
If her calculations were correct, she had expanded the inner dimensions of this room to the point that it was comparable to the theoretical scale of the entire universe!

“Now that was a lot of closet space.” she would chuckle at her self.
Oh god…. She was turning into her dad and sister.
Ruby shivered at the thought.
It's time to get back to work.

The Gigant queen then placed both of her hands in front of her and focused.
At first nothing happened.
Then suddenly, a spark of light flickered into existence, It seemed to vibrate a bit , as though it were dancing.
Then the spark grew until it became it became an orb of nigh infinite energy and potential the size of a basketball.
Ruby held the orb in her hands and hefted it's weight, Ruby smiled in satisfaction.
The Titaness then drew her mighty arm back and chucked the sphere with all her might into the endless void she created at a speed that no mortal instruments could ever hope to calculate.
It twinkled in the distance like a star.
And then it exploded
A nigh infinite amount of heat and energy expanded outwards from the point of detonation in all directions at speeds astronomically faster than light.
Ruby took the blast head on like a cham.
When the scarlet goliath opened her eyes she found herself swimming in an endless ocean of inconceivably hot primordial matter.
So far so good.
She then stirred up the material with her semblance until it became an endlessly churning maelstrom.
This next part was going to take a hot second so she accelerated the flow of time within this entire space by a factor of billions of years per minute.
Everything sped up around her as though someone pressed forward on a video.
The burning material cooled until it became vast gas clouds.
The clouds coalesced into dense burning masses that eventually became stars of various types including dark matter stars!
The entire life cycles of these stars played out in seconds until eventually they either exploded into super novas or became neutron and dwarf stars and even pulsars.
The burning hot material generated from the violent deaths of these of the star would eventually become nebulae that would eventually birth new stars that would produce an endless number of planetary and celestial bodies.

Ruby began to slow time back down to normal once everything reached a point that she liked.
The scarlet Titaness now found herself floating in an endless starry expanse that spread out before her.
It took her breath away.
This all came from her.
A wide smile split across the crimson Titaness’s face.
She felt the light from the stars caress her nude form, her clothes having completely ceased to exist from the explosion from earlier.
A sense of power and pride filled her being but most importantly a sense of peace.
This was the first time in her life she had ever pushed her semblance this far.
It felt good to cut loose.
Ruby shot off at speeds trillions of times the speed of light and soared through the twinkling void.
She ziged and zaged through the space without a care in the world , laughing all the while.
She eventually find a stellar system she liked and made for it.
Its star was a yellow dwarf surrounded by seven planets and a variety of celestial bodies of various sizes and states of development.
They all looked pretty but the one that caught her eye the most was the third most planet from the star
She zoomed towards it with a Sense of excitement and purpose, she had plans for this world.
She screamed through the planets atmosphere before impacting somewhere on the northern hemisphere.
Smoke rose from her body as she stood up from the massive crater her crash landing produced, she wondered if she making it a super hero landing made her look cool .
She jumped out of the crater and landed on her feet with a thunderous boom.
She took a moment to gauge her surroundings.
She found herself standing in the middle of a vast rocky plane under a brownish yellow sky.
It wasn't much to look at in the moment but that could easily be changed.
The question was what to do first….
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: Ruby almighty! Continued

1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: Meanwhile.....

choices: The girls get supplies and journey into the mysterious tunnel
The girls return to the tunnel, only to find something to help them get through
Check back with Ruby and her new reality.
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.content:
“Rubes? You home?”

The dorm room was rather quiet as Yang, Weiss, and Blake returned from their day, hoping to catch their team leader and go grab dinner. What they found instead was an empty room. Even that would have been harmlessly excused as the girls looked around, but there was nothing. No note indicating she had to do something, no reminder that Ruby had somewhere to be, just an empty dorm room. Blake shrugged, going through the motions of opening a closet door to get out a fresh pair of clothes, when a gasp from Weiss interrupted her.

“Guys? Do you see this?”

“See what?” Yang asked. “Is Ruby hiding in the closet?”

“No, but the closet is definitely hiding something. Take a look.”

Blake and Yang nodded at the ice maiden and went by where her section of the dorm was to take a look at the closet. What they saw inside not merely a collection of clothes, but what appeared to be a tunnel, stretching out far past their eyes could see.

“Did...someone dig a tunnel into the closet?” Yang asked. Blake shook her head at the suggestion.

“If someone did that, they would find themselves in one of the neighboring dorm rooms after only some slight digging. The walls are reinforced to Gigant standards, but there’s nothing beyond there but another closet.”

“But this...stretches on way longer than that,” Yang said. “Let me try something.”

Taking out a small rock, Yang threw it through the tunnel, hoping it would hit a door at the other end. Half a minute of silence was soon followed by a “Whoa.”

“What’s ‘whoa?’” Weiss asked.

“It’s endless. The rock didn’t even go through all of it. Come on. Maybe we can find a way through.”

Walking through the tunnel, Yang beckoned the others to follow, with Weiss leaping onto Blake’s shoulder and following through the closet door, down the endless tunnel. While the closet had some lighting, the group mostly noticed endless pair’s of Ruby’s outfits, save the occasional unique piece of clothing. However, after twenty minutes of walking, and not seeing anything resembling an exit, the trio began to get confused.

“It’s endless,” Weiss said. “Maybe it is an optical illusion. We know Ruby doesn’t have this many outfits. She wouldn’t need this many!”

The group looked at the floor in an attempt to see what, if anything would make them appear to be walking forward. Nothing. Nothing that would create a visual illusion, no smells or substances that would interfere with their senses, and the tunnel floor was...a tunnel floor. Sitting her gigantic butt on the floor of the tunnel, Yang pondered what was in front of her.

“This could go on for hours. Maybe days.”

“What are you suggesting?” Blake asked.

“I’m suggesting that if we just go forward without a plan, we’re going to get exhausted, lost, or both. I say we go get supplies, food, sleeping bags, and then try again.”

“It’s a tunnel in our closet,” Weiss said. “It can’t be that long, can it?” Grabbing a clump of material from the floor with her incredible strength, Weiss threw the material down the hall, only for it to fall without actually hitting anything.

“Do you want to travel and get hungry? Or worse, have one of us get hungry and you’re the only thing around to...”

“Hey!” Blake said. “I think she gets the point. “But Yang is right. If we’re going to get to the bottom of this, we need a plan.”

“What about class?”

“We found a portal on campus, in our dorm room, that seems to violate laws of time and space,” Blake said. “If anything, you’ll probably be a hero.”

The thought of inadvertently discovering a scientific breakthrough, in their own dorm closet no less, was too much for Weiss to ignore. Nodding, she agreed.

“You don’t suppose Ruby got lost in there, do you?” Blake asked. Yang shook her head.

“I think it’s a bit more complicated than that. But we’re not going to figure it out if we just sit here.”
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: Through the door

choices: The girls keep travelling, only to find more tunnel
The girls finally reach the end of the tunnel
The girls find something or someone that can help them get to the end
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.content:
A few hours later, the girls secured the same supplies they would for extended trips into the forest, necessities like food, sleeping bags, and even a lantern. Blake thought that the preparation was a bit much at first, but two hours into their walk, it was clear that the supplies were necessary.

The closet was the same proportions that it was originally in terms of width, meaning that while it fit the girls, it wasn't exactly the most spacious area to walk around in. Each side was filled with their leader's outfits, with the occasional varying uniform. The scenery did not go uncommented on.

"Ok, if Ruby EVER complains about her clothes again, we beat her senseless," Yang said.

"Agreed," Weiss replied. Blake nodded as well.

However, two hours became four, and even with breaks for food, water, and relief, the tunnel was proving to be a foe quite unlike any they had faced. Weiss became concerned, looking on at a compass she had bought with her, as well as her scroll.

"Well, wherever we are, the compass is going nuts, and the scroll can't get any sort of signal. Maybe we should have bought some sort of vehicle."

"You've got us," Yang said. As a general rule, their great size and incredible force meant that Gigants usually walked to most places, although there were exceptions. The primary issue of building machines on that scale for riders kept them from being used en masse, however.

"True, but this is getting ridiculous. This tunnel doesn't seem to have any sort of beginning or end." Off to the side, Blake had her nose in a book, shrugging.

"You should have bought something to keep your mind off the hike."

"How was I supposed to know Ruby's closet went the distance between three cities?" Yang's protests did little to ease the girls, causing her to sigh.

"Let's keep moving, the sooner we do, the sooner we find out where this ends."

---------

Hours had passed with nothing besides more tunnel to greet the trio as they walked down. Blake, looking on at the clothes, began to suspect something was wrong.

"There's no pattern. Are we actually walking, or is something here that's just making us think we're walking?"

"That can't be it," Yang said. "Wouldn't we smell, well...what we left a few hours ago? What about seeing food wrappers or embers from the lantern? Hell, footprints? The ground is all fresh. If we were walking in place, we'd notice those things no matter how far we think we went."

"Didn't expect you to be a detective," Weiss said. "But you're not wrong."

"Look, just because I've got all this brawn," Yang joked, flexing her arms, "doesn't mean my head's completely empty."

"So the good news is we're actually walking, and we're not seeing an optical illusion. The bad news is we've been walking for several hours through a tunnel that by all laws of physics, should not be here. Decorated by Ruby's outfits."

Looking at the outfits, Blake chuckled.

"So, Ruby apparently has a formal dress and a hazard suit?"

"What?" Weiss asked, only to see what Blake was holding. Alongside the near-endless supply of her regular outfit, she was holding two different outfits, specifically tailored to their massive team leader's scale. Weiss couldn't help but be confused.

"Almost like dresses for a doll. This is too weird."

"So where's Jetpack Ruby, so we can use it to get to the end of this tunnel! Or Ruby's all-terrain vehicle with attached laser guns?" Yang asked. "The clothes aren't helping us."

"Maybe further ahead?" Blake said.
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: Traversing the closet

choices: The girls open the door and see what’s there
Go back to Ruby and see what she’s up to
Someone else finds the closet door
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.content:
Fatigue was beginning to take its toll on the girls. Despite Yang and Blake’s great strides, the closet was proving to be a near endless foe, wearing the girls down through sheer attrition. The lack of any guiding marks besides the variant clothing for Ruby made their struggle seem all the more pointless as their travels continued. Sighing heavily, Weiss began to look around for something, anything that could ease the burden of their journey.

“None of these weirdo outfits have anything that can help?”

“In order,” Blake said, continuing to do her best to move forward through the fatigue she felt, “we ran into a stewardess outfit, a leather biker girl ensemble, military fatigues, a business suit, and a pirate costume. None of them had anything that would make us move faster.”

Weiss briefly snorted at the idea of the colossus that was Ruby wearing the pirate costume and trying to play along at the idea of being a pirate, but her mind quickly returned to the task at hand. At long last, it appeared that something had come up.

“Yang? Blake? I think I found something we can use.”

“Please say it’s a motorcycle,” Yang said, but from her perch on the massive blonde’s shoulder, Weiss shook her head.

“Not quite. It’s a bit more...immature. But considering whose clothes these are, I guess that makes sense.”

“What am I looking at?”

Weiss pointed to the item with her rapier, as both Yang and Blake quizzically realized what they were

“These look like roller skates for a waitress outfit,” Blake said. Indeed the four wheeled skates, two on each side, resembled those worn by waitresses. “I thought that was just in stories.”

“What, you didn’t have those car-side restaurants by where you were?” Yang said. ‘The girls skated up to the cars with the food.”

“Never saw anything like that outside of shows. And besides, skates will move us a bit faster, but how much faster?”

“These aren’t normal skates,” Weiss said. Observing in more detail, the two girls saw what was on each pair of them. Proportionally small rockets. On the side was a red button, presumably pressed to activate said rockets.

“This looks like something that an 8 year old would come up with,” Blake said, which caused Weiss to chuckle.

“No wonder they’re Ruby’s.” After sharing a laugh with Weiss, both Gigant girls, figuring they had nothing to lose, put the skates on. Surprisingly, they fit each girl near perfectly, a surprise given how much bigger their owner was than they were.

“You ready Weiss? I have no idea how fast this will go!”

“I’m gripping onto your shirt,” Weiss replied, “and I’ve got some ice serving as a harness. I should be alright.”

“OK, Blake, you ready?”

Nodding at Yang, the colossal cat Faunus prepared to deal with the bizarre circumstances the only way she could. Challenging them directly.

“On 3, 1, 2, 3!”

Both girls pressed the red buttons on their skates, but even they couldn’t be prepared for how quickly the rockets propelled them forward. None of the girls had any time for a snarky remark, the sheer speed of the skates sending them through the hallway that was the closet faster than anyone of them could respond. After some time had passed, the three girls were flung forward by the rockets exhausting their fuel, flinging the two Gigants and their passenger to the ground.

“Ugh,” Yang said, taking the skates off and getting to her feet. “I really would have preferred the motorcycle. You guys OK?”

Breathing heavily, Weiss nodded. “I had no idea we would go so fast.”

“Look at the bright side,” Blake said, getting to her feet. “They worked.”

A brief moment of confusion took the girls before they looked forward and saw what was in front of them. Rather than more hallway, it was a door.”

“So I guess we just open it, right?” Weiss asked.

“We’ve come too far to just report it,” Yang said. “Let’s see what’s behind Door #1, shall we?”
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: Accessories

choices: The creature takes them to where Ruby is
The creature has a stop to make first
Check back outside as someone finds the tunnel
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.content:
The door opened, and Yang braced herself for whatever was on the other side. With physics long having gone out the window, or being altered in such a way to make the tunnel feasible, the girls expected to see some sort of large room or an outdoor space Ruby had gone off to. And to their credit, the area was clearly outdoors.

“Whoa...”

“What’s...whoa...”, Weiss added from her perch on Yang’s shoulder, stunned at the sight before her. Blake appeared to be equally confused at what she saw, unable to put it into words.

“What are we looking at here?”

“I think it’s...outer space, Yang said. Sure enough, beyond the door was an endless field of black, dotted by stars in the distance. The girls could only look on at the starry expanse with wonder and confusion, asking themselves, and each other, what was out there, and what it had to do with Yang’s baby sister.

“That’s not possible,” Blake said. “We were in a tunnel. How did it reveal outer space?”

“Maybe it’s not outer space, per se,” Weiss said, going forward. “For one thing, it looks like we can breathe, rather than being sucked through into the vacuum of an actual void.

Tentatively, the girls walked through the door and found themselves able to walk, and more importantly, breathe in the expanse. Whether it was because the atmosphere from the tunnel extended into the expanse, or the laws of space simply took a holiday along with all the other weirdness they saw, none of them could say. This however, left the girls with a new problem.

“So we’ve gone from one endless trek,” Blake said, “to another endless trek. Where would Ruby even be in all of this?”

The girls stared uncomfortably at the endless space in front of them, pondering the question, since looking for Ruby in what could have been an entire universe would take...quite a bit of time to put it mildly. With no idea how far the breathable air would go, and no way to start looking, the group appeared to be at an impasse. That was, until another sight greeted them.

Illuminated by the stars and light from the doorway they had just entered, was a massive creature with blue and green skin, and a dorsal fin. It was a long, thick, round creature that seemed to “swim” through the starry expanse, appearing in front of the girls, to their confusion.

“A space whale?” Yang asked, her voice carrying a tone of disbelief. Blake walked up to the creature, big enough to swallow dozens of Gigants, and held her hand to its head.

“He’s friendly. I think he wants to take us somewhere.”

“You trust the big space whale?” Yang asked.

“Yeah, we should,” Weiss said. “Especially since it fits my theory.”

“What theory?”

“The tunnel, the space whale, the funny clothes. Ruby is somehow responsible for creating all this, and say what you will about our fearless leader, she would never purposefully try to hurt us. If she did find or make these things...somehow, they will be friendly.”

As if the creature had heard Weiss’ argument and agreed, the creature opened its mouth wide enough for the girls to enter. Blake nodded at the creature and walked inside, while Yang and Weiss followed. Luckily, inside the creature, air was breathable and the temperature was comfortable, almost as if the being was bred specifically to transport other organic creatures across the stars.

“That just leaves one question,” Yang said.

“What’s that?”

“How did Ruby create all of this?”

As the three girls pondered the answer, the ‘space whale’ took off at monumental speed, heading for its destination.
1123311222212222131112322221221121322221.title: The expanse beyond the door

1123311222212222131112322221222.title: More  exploration!

choices: Let's find out what they're doing
11233112222122221311123222212222.content: Ruby notices one or more of her friends wondering about the city. What could they be up to?
11233112222122221311123222212222.title: A friend spotted!

1123311222212222131112322222.content: Ruby decides to indulge her earlier mentioned "hunger" and scratch that "itch".
1123311222212222131112322222.title: Ruby in the mood

11233112222122221312.content:
For the next couple of minutes the four challengers stared down their opponent who simply stood there with a cocky grin on her face. The tension was almost palpable as the opposing parties waited for the other to make the first move. This went on for almost ten minutes before the crimson Gigant started to get impatient .
“ what's the matter guys ? Don't tell me you're getting cold feet.” Ruby mocked, attempting to goad her adversaries into action.
But they simply continued to maintain their combat stances.
Another ten minutes passed with the challengers simply before Ruby decided to take matters into her own hands.
“ If you're not gonna make a move than I guess I will!” the challengers put up their guard in response.
Ruby pondered on how to approach this battle until a wicked idea came to her. First, she called upon her semblance to conjure a pair of dust powered combat gauntlets and made it so that they have always been her weapons of choice.
Second, she made it so that her understanding and control over the application of dust was second only to the most prodigious and powerful of dust users.
And third, not only did she make it so that Gigants have astronomically more powerful auras relative to their size compared to normal sized people, she made it so that her control over her own aura was very close to perfect.
With her preparations complete, raised her right arm and proceeded to throw a light punch.
The resulting shock wave that was created rivaled the mightiest of hurricanes, shearing the landscape in front of her in a cone of destruction that stretched out before her by literal miles.
Meanwhile, the WBY of team RWBY and Pyrrha were completely stunned , having narrowly avoided the blast wave only to be flung for miles by the sheer wind pressure alone! The three massive forms of Yang, Blake,and Pyrrha slammed into the earth like meteorites, creating minor earthquakes that could be felt throughout the region all the way to the campus. The three of them just lied in their respective craters for a few moments, completely stunned by what just transpired. Blake was the first to get her wits back. She stood back up to her full 62 feet in height and stared down her leader with a determined edge, a fire had been lit within her. She crouched down and entered a running stance, never taking her eyes off of her opponent, broke off into a blind sprint. The Giant cat faunus's ludicrously powerful muscles launched her forwards at ridiculously fast speeds, A sonic boom erupting into being and tearing the surrounding landscape asunder. Surrounded by a cone of heat and pressure, she left behind a wake of molten stone and glass as she ran forward with her hand on the hilt of her gambol shroud, in preparation to strike down her opponent in single blow. The instant she got within Ruby's personal bubble, gigantic ninja drew her weapon out for a massively hypersonic strike only for it to be blocked by the scarlet juggernaut's beefy forearm, the pressure wave generated from the strike slicing the tops of a nearby mountain range clean off. Just as Blake lost her footing, another Blake came down from above to deliver a over head strike, having been hidden in the chaos of Ruby's devastating first attack. Ruby however, thanks to her new Aura enhanced senses, saw this attack coming a mile away grabbed the clones blade in between her index finger and thumb. Before the clone could register what had happened, the Red Titaness swung her arm around with incredible force and slammed the clone into the original Blake, the sheer force sending both skidding across the ground at high speeds and creating a several hundred mile long trench as they did. Their impromptu journey would come to a halt when they collided with a mountain with a deafening boom, the impact compromising its structural integrity and causing it to collapse on top of them. A few moments later, Blake erupted explosively from her earthy tomb, causing millions of tons of stone and debris to be flung into the air for hundreds of miles in all directions. The disheveled colossal cat faunus blew a strand of hair out of her face. Clearly she would have to pull out all the stops if she was to have a chance at winning. Not even two seconds later did a hundred identical copies of the aloof huntress shimmer into existence. They gave each other a nod before charging towards the general direction of their opponent even faster than before! Back at the ruined clearing, Ruby marveled at her strength. Never in her wildest imaginations did she ever think she could this strong! And to think, she had actually spent the majority of her young life living in FEAR of her power.
Well. Better late than never she supposed.
It was then that her super human ears picked up the distinct sound of an object screaming through the atmosphere at mind boggling speeds , and a whole bunch of them if the number of Sonic booms she heard were anything to go by.
The very atmosphere burned around them as Blake and her small army of clones descended upon the silver eyed colossus like a shower of meteorites, half them maneuvering through the air using the sheer force of their kicks to propel them.
The Blake army began to swarm around their target, each one delivering an imperceptibly fast flurry of strikes upon their who casually blocked them with her own high speed movements. Lost in the intensity of their battle, the two titans didn't notice that the sheer force and speed of their exchanges had caused a massive maelstrom to form around them, causing category 5 typhoons and F6 tornadoes to manifest across an area comparable to hundreds of miles in diameter!



Weiss woke up feeling incredibly groggy, her head pounding as though an ursa was beating upon it like a drum. Bleary eyed, checked her surroundings trying to make out where she was. One thing she noticed was that wherever she was felt like she was surrounded by something warm and soft. When her vision cleared she saw that she was between two great fleshy looking masses. Confused, she turned her head upwards only to pause when she finally figured out where she was. She stuck in the cleavage of a Gigan woman. Specifically Pyrrha‘s Cleavage. The Schnee Heiress's face turned a bright shade of red.
She began to stammer a large number of apologies when an ear piercing boom followed by powerful gusts of wind assaulted her. The usually cold tempered girl's head spun wildly around for the source. She became aware of the fact that they were caught in the middle of an immensely powerful gale storm unlike anything she's ever seen.
From the poor normal sized girl's perspective it appeared as though the end of the world was upon them. She wildly spun her head around searching for the source , anything to explain how this was happening.
When she found it however, she stopped dead in her tracks.
Her open fell open and became dry and hear eyes became pinpricks as a potent combination of terror and awe overcame her.

In the heart of this apocalyptic storm was the forms of two of her teammates locked in an fierce battle. The Cat faunus and her hundred semblance born copies flew around their opponent at incomprehensible velocities delivering blows that could reduce entire mountains to dust with each strike while her team's leader, as completely insane as it sounds, was simply swatting them away as though they were nothing. All the while, the very earth and sky quaked, buckled, and twisted under the weight of their blows.
This was far more than a mere bout between huntresses. This was battle between veritable Demigods and she, a mere puny mortal little person, was caught right in the middle.
“My gods….” Those were the only words she was able to vocalize.
It was at this moment that Weiss wondered what could have possibly possessed her to believe that she could even keep up with the giants let alone win against them.
A Full minute had passed before the Fearful girl was able to get enough of her wits back to speak.
“P-Pyrrha! This has gotten out of hand! We have to get out of here! …Pyrrha?”

Unfortunately for Weiss, her words fell on deaf ears as the Spartan girl was deep in concentration.
Rarely has anyone goaded her competitive streak quite like the crimson juggernaut before her. So many of her opponents in the past simply didn't have what it took to excite her warrior spirit. but with this person, she felt like she didn't have to hold anything back.

So she didn't.

She Reached out with her polarity semblance and touched the earth, feeling out for the metallic elements in the ground. When she found what she was looking for she focus her energies on moving them.
What followed was the deafening sound of millions of tons stone and dirt shifting and grinding against each other in an unrelenting cacophony of chaos as the ground beneath them began to visibly move and shift, earthquakes registering from 7.8 to 8.6 on the Richter scale radiated from the champion's position in discordant rhythms.
Weiss screamed at the vermillion haired Amazon to explain what she was doing only to be stunned into dumb silence when she saw her what she had done
A hunk of earth, stone and metal comparable to the total mass of the island of patch hung high in the sky directly over the spot where Ruby chose to hold her ground.

The Spartan’s intent was obvious at this point. The Schnee scion buried herself deeper into the amazon's bountiful cleavage, as it was the safest place to hide from the imminent disaster.

The mistral champion swung her arms downward, causing the rocky mass to plummet towards the earth at dizzying speeds.
Meanwhile, Ruby and the Blake clones continued their exchange.
As the battle raged on, Blake's strikes hit heavier and faster with Ruby responding in kind. There blows were so strong and fast at this point that the heat and friction that was generated from them caused self contained electrical storms to form-
11233112222122221312.title: Clash of Titans!

112331122221222213121.content:
around their bodies. Massive arcing bolts of lightning discharged off from their causing further damage to the landscape.
Ruby was having the time of her life. The power coursing through her was intoxicating, especially since an hour or two ago she was a scrawny one hundred something pound weakling.
At some point in her duel with Blake she Began to notice that everything became dark.
Confused, the Gigant queen looked at the sky.
It appeared as though an asteroid was about to come crashing down on her and Blake.
This was obviously Pyrrha's handy work Ruby concluded, she gave an appreciative whistle at the sight.
She decided that she should probably deal with this.

“Sorry Blake but it's about time ended this little game of patty cake!”
Ruby proceeded to flex her godly muscles with enough force that once again sent Blake and her clones to be sent flying away from her at blinding speeds all at once, leaving a dazed and bewildered cat faunus to wonder what just happened.
In that same moment, The crimsonette firmly into the ground and stared daringly up at the man made asteroid, a sardonic smile plastered on her face all the while. She pulled her arm back to ready a punch, her fist squeezed so tight that it could crush and split atoms, and swung up into the oversized dirt clod.
The sheer force of the blow caused the falling land mass to instantly disintegrate and created gale force winds powerful enough to rip cites out from their foundations that launched the debris high into the upper atmosphere.
Meanwhile, just before Ruby's counter attack, Pyrrha was readying a powerful follow up attack.
The Olympian Titaness called upon her polarity semblance to gather metallic matter which she super heated through electro magnetic induction and concentrated it into a single point along with a whole mess of highly charged particles she pulled from the atmosphere.

The result was a slowly growing white hot ball of super energetic matter and energy forming in front of her.

Weiss, though she knew that the durability semblance was, felt that she was going to be incinerated if she stayed in the ball's presence.
And then Ruby threw her punch.
The ensuing typhoon that was produced surpassed the ones generated by Blake's assault a thousand times over. The slicing winds buffeted against the Spartan's hulking frame in a nigh unending onslaught but she held fast.
The same couldn't be said of Weiss however.
The snow white huntress held onto a thick piece of breast flesh for dear life, Terror having long since consumed her mind at this point. Her face was distorted by the winds and she felt her grip slipping, she prayed to any force that would listen to let her live through this moment. A few moments later and she could hold on no longer. She was literally thrown through the storm like a leaf in a hurricane and was twisting in the like one too , screaming all the while.

Ruby was triumphantly flexing her arms over her conquest over the asteroid when she was suddenly hit by a blindingly bright light.
Pyrrha had finished charging the ball which now possessed so much energy it super charged the surrounding atmosphere, creating an aurora borealis around her towering form that could be seen for miles.
A confident smirk had appeared on the Amazon's face, she was more than ready to show this oversized kid exactly what she was made of. With a push and a roar of effort, she used her semblance to accelerate the energized mass into a lancing beam at speeds that rivaled even the most powerful of particle accelerators.

Ruby in the meantime, was so mesmerized by the brilliant light show that she almost didn't notice the energy beam moving at her in excess of 0.99999999999% the speed of light.

With transcendental reaction time, she channeled the gravity dust in her gauntlets , super charged it with her aura , and generated powerful waves of gravitic energy which she used to distort the fabric of space-time and curved the beam upwards, creating a pillar of light that pierced the Heavens and escaped into the inky black void that could be seen for thousands of miles.

As the beam eventually dissipated, Ruby wiped sweat from her brow, relieved that she was fast enough when she did. Had that hit her she was worried that she might have been moved from her spot.
Suddenly, Pyrrha appeared to deliver a earth splitting slash to the cookie loving juggernaut's back, having seemingly materialized out of thin air. She was stopped short, her weapon had been caught between the folds of the Gigant queen's mighty back muscles.
The scarlet huntress looked back at Pyrrha over her hulking shoulder, giving her one of the largest shit eating grins she had ever seen.
“ My turn!” shouted the silver eyed warrior who than grabbed the stunned Spartan from behind and chucked her into the air. She then channeled a bit of energy dust into her hand and thrusted an open palm into the air to release a destructive lance of light which hit its mark square in her chest , triggering an explosion comparable to a nuke.

A few moments passed with nothing happening, the only sound being that of the wind and the residual rumbling caused by Pyrrha's attack.
Ruby simply stood in her spot staring at the ruined landscape waiting for any challengers to approach her.
Ruby let out a booming roar of triumph that shook the earth and Heavens and seemed to cause the very planet to tremble!
Yes! She had won! This new body was amazing! It was beyond amazing. It was downright GODLY!!!
If she knew that she would have become this strong she would have used her semblance years ago!
The Gigant queen would then proceed perform a series of poses for no other reason than because she could and felt that the situation warranted it.
However throughout her self indulgent congratulatory celebration , she couldn't help but feel she that she was forgetting something very important.
A massive sky piercing pillar of fire erupted into existence almost immediately after she thought that.

Oh right. Yang.

Ruby raised her fists and prepared to face down her “Big” sister.

Yang had spent the majority of this sparring match watching her teammates fight her sister from the safety of the crater she made when this whole thing started in order to ponder on her plan of attack.
She may not use her head that much in general but doesn't mean she doesn't use it at all.

The elder xiaolong sibling knew her sister too well to try to come at her with half measures so she had think of a way to not only catch her off guard but also break through her defenses. She thought long and hard on her strategy until she remembered something vital. She had developed a technique for just such an occasion. She had learned long ago that , as a rule, Gigants have astronomically more powerful souls and auras compared to other lifeforms and had found a way to exploit it
She closed her eyes and began focusing her aura into a single point until it became a dense concentration and stockpiled it away. Then she waited for her Gigant soul to completely regenerate her aura and repeated the entire process. Even as the cataclysmic battle raged on outside her crater the blonde brawler continued to diligently gather aura.
Eventually everything went quite until she heard her sister roar at the sky, probably believing that she had already won, but by then she was done.
Yang stood up at her full height of 69 feet ready to unleash the “Big Yang".
Back in the present, Ruby looked in awe at her sister, who now appeared as though her body was made of flame, and raised her arms up in excitement.
“Wow!! Since when could you do that!?” said the crimson goliath with amazement in her voice.
The elder xiaolong sibling smiled with pride at her sister's reaction.
“I came up with it myself. I call it…… THE BIG YANG!” the titanic bombshell accentuated that last three by pounding her fist into her palm, which had the effect of causing yet another earthquake to surge through the poor abused land.

“That's so cool.” Ruby exclaimed with wonder.
She then took on an aggressive stance, donning a cocky grin.
“But I'm afraid that it won't be enough.” The scarlet Titaness stated in a matter-of-fact tone.
Yang returned her sister's gesture with a grin of her own.
“ we'll see about that”

The two sisters stared each other down for a few seconds before the eldest made launched her
Attack.
Yang kicked off the ground with such force that the resulting sonic boom was enough to not only peel off thousands of acres of land all the way down to the bed rock but also instantly converted it into white hot plasma.
At the speeds she was moving, her body more resembled a beam of golden light than a person. Everything around her was completely vaporized as she approached her target. Milliseconds before the Titanic Berserker threw a powerful right hook while simultaneously releasing her stores of energy.
Ruby barely had time to raise her arms in defense before the attack landed.
A sound akin to thousands of nukes going off tore through the atmosphere as a 5 kilometer tall cone of heat and plasma surged across the land for tens of hundreds of miles and beyond, evaporating anything and everything in its path while liquefied earth and bed rock radiated from the point of impact.
A few moments before Yang's attack hit, Blake and Pyrrha had gotten up few minutes prior and stood in awe at the spectacle before they were engulfed in the blast wave.
At the same time, Weiss, who had been flung across the landscape by the asteroid obliterating gale storm punch, had just pulled herself out of a Weiss and weakly got to her feet. When she observed her surroundings, she didn't see amiss.
You know.
Other than the devastated wasteland that used to be their training grounds.
For the briefest of moments, the ice queen thought that the
112331122221222213121.title: Clash of titans Continued 2

1123311222212222131211.content:
worst of it was over.
Then she looked up and saw a literal tsunami of flame and molten stone rushing towards her.
“Fuck me…”
Were the Last words she uttered before being washed away by the burning tide.

When the light and heat of the “Big Yang” attack finally died down, Yang could be found with her right arm outstretched and smoking. The Giant blonde beauty panted heavily from her effort, hoping that her last move was enough.

When the smoke cleared however, Yang discovered, to her horror, that Ruby was not only still standing but hadn't even budged an inch.
Ruby meanwhile was looking down at her sister with that same cocky smirk from before.
“is that all you got?” Ruby taunted her sister.
Incidentally, Ruby noticed that be she and her sister were completely stark naked.
In fact, all five combatants had their clothes completely incinerated by the blast.
Ruby felt her face flush with embarrassment but pushed the feeling down, now was not the time For that.
Yang felt a surge of anger wash over from her “little” sister's remark and wound up a second “Big Yang", This time with a left hook.
Ruby was ready for her this time and countered with an ice dust infused right hook of her own.
The two giant women roared at each other as their fists collided.
Yet another blast of earth shattering proportions was released as Hot and cold clashed, creating a maelstrom of ice and fire that was greater than all the others before it combined.
This mixing of hot and cold in rapid succession had the side effect of causing super cells to form from the hot and cold fronts produced by the vortex, creating monsoons which unleashed an unending deluge of torrential downpours to spread all across the region.
In the eye of the storm, the two titans were locked in their struggle of biblical proportions, their fists pressed against each other. At the point were their fists met, massive bolts of energy snaked off and caused even more astronomical damage to the surrounding landscape, the arcing streams carving out great gouges into the earth.

Ruby saw a chance to end this clash by grabbing the brawler’s wrist where she than spun around at high speeds before chucking her skywards above the clouds!


As Yang shot up into the sky at blinding speeds, she couldn't help but feel a little discouraged that her first attack didn't end it but she had expected something like this would happen but she wasn't about to give up!
She may be down ( or up in this case) but she was far from being out.
The Blonde beauty used her powerful muscles to reorient herself in the air in an incredible display of agility.
In that same motion, she called upon her aura reserves and released them, immediately stopping her ascent and began focusing her aura into her core.
The sheer output of energy she emitted was enough to suspend her in midair, her body once more being engulfed in golden flames which continued to grow brighter and hotter by the second. The energy kept building and growing hotter and brighter until it appeared as though there was a second sun in the sky, banishing the rain clouds in the process. The energy had built up so much That a Corona of fire and light had formed around the monumental pugilist that continued to grow until it's light and searing heat could be seen for thousands of miles, complete with sun flare like tendrils of plasma snaked off her body and carved deep molten hot gouges into the land wherever they struck.
Yang had to keep gathering more power if her plan had any hope of working.
No half measures would suffice.
She began to focus the power into her fists, preparing to unleash an unending barrage of “Big Yang" punches.
Unfortunately for her though, Ruby had other plans.

Ruby channeled gravity dust in her hand and pointed it at the living star that was her sister then started pouring massive amounts of aura into the dust reaction.
The air and light started to ripple as the very fabric of space became distorted from the sheer volume of gravitic energy being generated and focused into a relatively small space.
The distortions continued grow worse until the very light began to get swallowed up into the point of impenetrable blackness that was the artificial black hole that spontaneously sprung into existence.
As the singularity continued to grow, massive chunks of land and debris were torn from the surrounding landscape and drawn towards its gaping maw, flying around in twisting circles before being disintegrated as they made contact with its ego sphere due to spaghettification.
It grew until it even began to swallow the tendrils of power that bled off the massive brawler's body, causing a fiery accretion disc to form around it.
Meanwhile, the fiery blonde was desperately fighting against the pull of the gravitational anomaly, but it was a losing battle. With a final earth shaking roar, she released a hellish blast of power in an attempt to push herself away but was eventually overpowered and drawn into its depths.
Ruby, seeing that her plan worked, moved her arm in a throwing motion and hurled the virtual black hole off into the distance, when it landed a brilliant pillar of azure and indigo light erupted into existence, piercing the sky with a combination of gamma radiation and hard X-rays.
A few minutes prior to the event, Pyrrha and Blake had to shield their eyes from the intensity of the light their mutual friend gave off. Blake wondered where her teammate was hiding all that power and why she didn't use it earlier when the match started. Meanwhile Pyrrha was over here in stunned amazement at the fiery Gigant’s display and began forming plans to ask the girl for a match.
Elsewhere on the Ruined battlefield, Weiss had broken out of a bubble of molten stone and ice she created with her semblance at the very last second before the burning death tsunami hit only to be hit by an impossibly bright light.
It was HOT! Super HOT!!
It was so hot that the fencer knew that if it weren't for the effects of the durability semblance she would've instantly vaporized into nothingness by now.
Her nerves were completely shot and have been shot for a while now. And to top it off, she found that her clothes were completely destroyed, leaving her standing in her birthday suit. At this point all she wanted to do was go home and sleep this whole experience off like a bad dream.
In the midst of being burned alive and lamenting the consequences of her poor decision, she noticed a new development began to unfold.
“oh what is it this time!” she said to herself out loud.
The heiress stared at the battlefield in apprehension as the world seemed to visibly distort in front of her.
Instantly she recognized it as the effects of gravity dust but it was on a scale that she had never seen before.
Even with the durability semblance she could feel her teeth forcefully grind together from the gravity waves that slammed into her and weighed her down. The waves grew so strong that she was physically unable to move her body and was even brought to her knees. Then, just before it became too much to bare, it stopped.
The frazzled girl was able to stand back up again but was not relieved. For she saw why it stopped.
A black hole had appeared over the ruined landscape swallowing everything around it including the second sun
That was scorching everything around it a second ago.
The young woman began to chuckle which eventually became full blown laughter.
This was absurd. This whole situation was just ridiculous.
It was as though she had stepped into one of those shonen animes Nora liked to rave on about sometimes or some poorly written story made by some random people on a creative writing website.
She continued to laugh her head off for a good five minutes as she was most likely overwhelmed by temporary insanity.
Her laughter was cut short when she heard an earth rumbling sound that she has become all too familiar with.
Her face twisted into a mask of horror when she saw the very earth she was standing on ripped from it's foundations and pulled into the sky towards the hungry void. A blood curdling scream tore through her lips as she fell into its depths.


Yang was feeling pretty bummed out right now. She had thought she had finally become strong enough to beat her younger sister in a fight by herself but that was clearly not the case.
When the colossal firebrand had awoken she had found herself floating in a black featureless void. She had spent five hours trying to find a way out but came up empty each time and so with nothing to do she opted to wait it out, whatever this was. The place the sunny goliath found herself in was a space that existed past the event horizon the artificial black hole as a sort of pocket universe of seemingly endless nothingness as far as the eye could see where space and time ceased to have any meaning. Though only a few moments would have past on the outside, from the perspective of the brawler, twenty one days would pass by where she simply floated in the black expanse thinking and waiting for something to happen.
Eventually, her patience would be rewarded when one day, after playing twenty questions with herself for the millionth time, she saw a pinprick of light in the corner of her eye, it was difficult to tell whether it was far away or not in this place by she could swear that it looked like it was growing, as though it was getting closer. Her theory would be proven correct when the light expanded and engulfed her entire field of view. She raised her arms in an attempt to shield herself before everything went white.
When she next came to, she found herself at the bottom of a deep hole that appeared as though it was burned through rather than dug out.
As she lay on her back she concluded that she and her fellow Gigant teammates would have to take on Ruby at the same time if they were to have any chance at winning.
Yang stood up to her full 69 foot height and dusted herself off before kicking off
1123311222212222131211.title: Clash of Titans! Continued 3

11233112222122221312111.content:
the ground at break neck speeds that produced a powerful sequence of sonic booms in her wake.
Somewhere across the battle scarred plane, the Spartan and the cat faunus were holed up in one of the many massive chasms that were made during the duration of this competition trying to come up with a plan to move the scarlet juggernaut from her spot when they heard a thunderous boom followed by the sight of a blazing form streaking across the sky towards their location.
With a mighty crash, the hulking form of the Blonde bombshell landed in front of the other two challengers in a crouching position.
She stood up and shook her wild golden hair loose of any debris and turned to face her teammates.
“Well. That didn't work.” The Brawler stated Bluntly.
“ No kidding.” The gigantic Ninja replied with a healthy amount of snark.
“What was that all about? It looked like you turned into a sun!” Pyrrha shouted excitedly.
Yang beamed with pride at the duelist’s reaction. “ I call it the BIG YANG! I came up with it myself.”
“That's incredible! You MUST tell me how you did it!” Pyrrha asked enthusiastically, the flames of her warrior spirit stoked more than they ever been before.

“Maybe later. Right now we have a match to win!” the towering Blonde beauty raised her fist in the air as she made her declaration, her massive naked breasts bounced wildly from the action.
“ And how are we supposed to do that?” Blake said almost dismissively, she pulled a random piece of charred shrubbery out of her disheveled hair and chucked it behind her. “she's shrugged off pretty much everything we've thrown at her so fat and she doesn't even look like she's broken a sweat!” Doubt at their chances of victory had become evident on her face.
Pyrrha nodded in agreement .

“That's why we're all going to attack her at the same time!” Yang declared heroically, undeterred by the odds stacked against her. She then brought her teammates together in a huddle.
“Look. The way I see it, our best option is for all of us to come at her from all sides. That way she has to focus all her energy trying to keep track of us, making it easier to catch her off balance so we can push her out of her little circle.”
Pyrrha had nodded in approval at the plan where as Blake grabbed her left arm with a look of uncertainty.
“I don't know….”
Yang placed her hand on her feline friends shoulder.
“ Is going to work. Trust me.” She said reassuringly.
The goliath black cat woman began to perk up.
“All right I'm in.”
Yang pumped her fist in joy.
Pyrrha drew out her sword and shield.
“Besides. This is the best plan we have.” The Spartan chimed in.
“ if this doesn't work nothing will”
The other two women nodded in agreement.
They gathered what was left of their gear and stormed off in the direction of the giant red menace.

Ruby was very pleased with herself. She had thwarted her sister's strongest attack and shut down her counter attacks before she could even fire them off, all without exerting any effort.
She laughed a deep full belly laugh that shook the eath. She felt unstoppable! Nothing could beat her! She was the strongest one there is!
As she basked in the throes of her power high, she saw three massive figures heading towards her position.
“so they decided to come at me all at once. Eh?” The crimson force of nature mused to herself.
Good.
Ruby turned towards them with open arms as the challengers approached her to make what was most likely their final assault.

The three lesser Gigants wasted no time on their attacks.
Blake let loose the opening salvo in the form of one thousands clones coming at the scarlet Titaness with a level of ferocity that would make even the greatest of Atlisan soldiers and the most savage of grimm cower in terror. Her assault from when this exercise was as nothing before the hellish bombardment the book loving woman unleashed, each individual blow delivered by her and her clones carried a hundred times more destructive force than that of her opening attack in it's entirety, she even infused her weapon with lightning dust for good measure.
In response, Ruby had channeled energy dust to erect a barrier around herself. Countless bolts of electrical arced out in all directions as the Blake army’s attacks struck against it.
Next came Yang who flew in like a blazing comet and started wailing on Ruby's shield with a machine gun like flurry of punchs, each hit that connected created something hundred mile long fissures in the earth that spewed lava high into the air like volcanoes.
And finally Pyrrha, who opted to hang in the back.
If one were to have looked in the sky at that moment it would appear as though the stars had come out earlier than they were supposed to, but they would be wrong.
Those were not stars. They were countless balls of super dense plasma arranged into a dome like pattern that acted as an inescapable kill box spanning a thousand miles in diameter. With a look of serene calm and focus, she willed the orbs to unleash their payload. Millions and millions of searing hot spears of light lanced through the air towards the central location of the red earth shakers and hit their mark.
Mere seconds before the beams of death struck, Ruby had altered the properties of her force field to make the lasers refract away from her in all directions. This did something to the effect of producing a laser light show of countless prismatic beams of light that the entire country was privy to.

As the three challengers poured everything they had in their in their final assault, Ruby couldn't help but feel a sense of pride well up within her.
In such a short amount time her teammates have grown to such astonishing levels. There was even a moment where she was actually afraid that they were going to pull the rug out from under her.
This sparring match was some of the greatest fun she's had in years! But she decided that she finally had her fill for the day.
It was time to end this.
Within the protective walls of her barrier, The silver eyed Gigant stood up to her full 92 Imposing feet of height and opened her arms wide. Then , after channeling a potent cocktail of different dust mixtures and adding a layer of reality warping into the mix for good measure, she gave a playful wink towards her friends before clapping her hands together.
What followed would be written down in the history books of remnant for generations to come.
A massive wave of light and energy rushed across the land in the blink of an eye.
Its scale was such that the entirety of the region they were fighting in was subsumed by an impenetrable dome of power that could be seen from orbit.
So great were the forces unleashed that not only was the entire country bombarded by a seemingly unending torrent of massive earthquakes and typhoons, but actual tears and distortions in reality would start to pop up all over the planet.
This brilliant display of destruction that would undoubtedly spawn several new religions, lasted for ten whole minutes before eventually subsiding into nothingness.

Weeks(?) ago somewhere else. A familiar ice queen was pacing around in circles and aimlessly firing dust bolts into the void simply because there was nothing else to do.
When she had first woken up she had found herself marooned on a floating island, which she would recognize as the massive piece of land she was standing on before it and she were sucked into the virtual black hole, set adrift in an infinite abyss of Black emptiness alongside other huge chunks of land.
She had spent the first five days searching for anything resembling an exit from this inky black purgatory to no
Avail. Panic set in as she feared the worst, followed by an endless tirade of rage aimed at Ruby and her fellow Gigant classmates which eventually led to the heiress falling to her knees in despair and anguish, finally ending with her curling up into a of resignation and apathy.
That was five weeks ago.
During all that time, Weiss had decided to spend it thinking about things, it was the only other thing to do here other pace around and shoot dust bolts.
She pondered on all the events that lead her here.
About all the sacrifices she had to make to get to where she was, about all the struggles and hardships she had to endure, about how all of it was rendered completely nil in the presence of even the weakest and most humble of Gigants, and about the sheer absurdity of her situation.
How was she even still alive for starters.
The only logical explanation she could come up with was that Ruby's durability semblance somehow also maintained its target's bodily functions, which would explain how she was able to go without food or water for days on end.
Not that it even mattered at this point.
The frigid young woman stewed in self pity for hours as has become her routine.
She was stirred from her chronic malaise when she noticed a pinprick of light in the distance.
At first she had thought that she had finally gone insane until it started to get bigger at terrifying rate.
She instantly raised a glyph in defense out of fear and reflex before being engulfed by the light.
11233112222122221312111.title: Clash of Titans! Continued 4

choices: We check on Weiss who has been flung someplace  far away
112331122221222213121111.content:
When she came to she felt the sensation of sunlight and water hitting her face. She groggily rose up from her unplanned bed to get a better look at where she was.
She discovered that she had been laying in a puddle made from the long melted ice wall she created to defend herself and that she was at the bottom of a deep crevasse. She began to chain hop her way towards the top of the gap using her glyphs as platforms.
When she finally got out, she was beholden to the familiar sight of the obliterated hellscape that was once the training grounds.
The Fencer would experimentally pinch her cheeks.
Than she would slap herself.
Than she violently punched herself in the stomach with an aura enhanced fist and puke up whatever was left in her stomach.
She sat there in silence for a minute.
The she started to weep and produce insane laughter. She was free! SHE WAS FREE!!!!
she was free from that empty Black hell!
A powerful sense of relief and gratitude washed over her.
She also noticed, to her delight, that she didn't hear anything resembling the sound of battling Gigants.
Was it finally over?
The Heiress's petite body racked with her hysterical laughter at the prospect.
She was than suddenly and violently knocked out of her revelry by a world shakingly loud noise.

Oh no…….

The Fencer slowly turned her head towards the source of the sound.
A massive white hot dome/wall of light and power took up her entire field of vision, stretching across the horizon and piercing the sky. It consumed everything around it as it expanded.
And it was heading right for her.
Weiss fell to her knees and simply smiled in resignation.
There was no point.
And then the entire world became white.

The scarlet Titaness gazed down upon her work in satisfaction. The entire region she and her opponents were fighting in only moments prior had been reduced to a smoldering crater of glass and molten material that stretched out in all directions as far as the eye could see, creating a vast chasm extending thirteen miles underground.
Speaking of opponents.
The Gigant queen extended her aura enhanced senses across the ruined plane in search of them.
Eventually she had picked up the three distinct spiritual energy signatures of her fellow Gigants and friends in different parts of the annihilated region.
All three of them were either physically embedded in the ground, encased in a mass of solidified glass, or totally submerged in a literal lake of lava and fire.
They were all stunned, bruised, and completely out of it, the only reason they are even still breathing is thanks to the power of the durability semblance. Regardless, the fact remained at they were no longer able to fight.
But Ruby wasn't done yet.
The world breaking teen crouched down to the ground and dug an unimaginably powerful hand into the ground and projected her durability semblance over a vast area .
And then, with one arm, she proceeded to lift a mass comparable to half the size of the entire region over her head, holding it together with her durability semblance.
She then shook the entire mass as though it where a stubborn cardboard box that refused to release its contents which had the intended effect of releasing the stilled forms of her friends their prisons and causing them to enter a free fall.
With a flick of her wrist, Ruby drew the trio towards herself and caught them in the crushing embrace of her arms, held firmly against her naked mountainous bosom!
She then dropped the mass back in place.
The shock waves produced by the impact were enough to cause earth quakes and tidal waves to breakout across the planet.

Ruby gazed down at the three Gigant women entrapped against the surface of her mastodonian breasts and smiled at them.
“Looks like I win!” The Crimson haired girl exclaimed happily.
The three groaned in great discomfort before the Fiery brawler mustered up enough of her wits to speak.
“Yeah Yeah you won. Now could you please put us down?Being smooshed against my baby sister's boobs is really embarrassing, let alone alongside three other people.”
Ruby had the decency to blush at her sister's remark and immediately set the three combatants down.
“ He he sorry…” Ruby apologized sheepishly while rubbing the back of her head.
The three Gigant women worked out the kinks in their bruised and battered bodies and cleaned themselves off as best they could.
While the other two challengers were licking their wounds, the elder xiaolong sibling paced around in a circle with her arms folded over her substantial bare melons before growling in frustration and kicking a stray rock on the ground, inadvertently sending it to orbit.
“RAAAGH!! DAMN IT RUBY! YOUR JUST TOO STRONG!!!”
The hulking bombshell shouted angrily at her sister.
“I really thought I had you this time. But you just kept swatting away my punches like they were nothing!! LIKE YOU ALWAYS DO!!!”
She then proceeded to fall on her ginormous butt and pouted like a little kid.
Ruby just smirked at that statement.
“What can I say? I'm a big girl.” Ruby empathized those last words by flexing her two perfect arms.
Yang simply grumbled in response.
Ruby took on a more softer tone as she knelt down next to her sister.
“Hey, if it makes you feel any better there were a bunch of times during the match were I thought I was gonna lose “
Ruby stated matter-of-factly.
Yang was not convinced. “Your just saying that.”

Ruby raised her hands in a defensive gesture. “ No really! I mean it! When you used that “Big Yang" thing of yours I really thought I was going to be pushed out of the ring!”
She then gestured to the other two Gigants women.
“same thing with you guys as well! When Pyrrha for fired that crazy doom laser of hers or even when Blake came at me with all those clones, I really started sweating bullets.”
The blonde Brawler Looked up at her sister with a twinge of hopefulness in her eyes. “reeeaally?”
Blake Placed her hand on her partner's bulky shoulder.
“ she's right Yang. It may not be by much, but we have definitely gotten closer to actually beating Ruby in a match and we're only going to get stronger.”
Pyrrha nodded in agreement. “I'll say. You guys are among the few people I've met that can actually given me a workout! We have to spar with each other again sometime!
A few moments of consideration later and the wild maned giantess decided to believe these words and immediately perked up.
“You know what you're right, we are pretty awesome. And we're only going to get better!” she shouted with renewed confidence.
Yang turned to look up at her sister and leader with her trademarked daring smile restored.
“And who knows? Maybe the next time we fight. I'LL be the “BIG” sister.
Ruby returned her sister's grin with her own
“ Don't bet on it!”
The Four giant all laughed earth shaking laughs
Things were going to get a lot more interesting the girls in the future.
As this heart to heart played out however, the girls couldn't shake this ever growing nagging sensation that something was amiss, as if they were forgetting something really important.
Blake was the first to act on this feeling.“ Has anyone seen Weiss?”
The four women looked at each other with concern.
Only one thing could be said.
“Ah shit.”
112331122221222213121111.title: Clash of Titans! Continued 5

choices: She had landed  somewhere in atlas
1123311222212222131211111.content:
Weiss found herself once again waking up in a hole, A feeling that has gotten very old.
Sighing, she had decided to get it over with and assess the situation. As she stood up though, she started to feel a very noticeable draft . Confused, she looked down at her self and was reminded that she was , indeed, butt naked.
Feelings of frustration and embarrassment washed over her like powerful tides.
She wanted to scream.
She wanted to cry.
She wanted to do……SOMETHING to make the knot in her stomach go away.
But she stifled those thoughts, she would have plenty of time for that later. For now, she had to figure out where she was.
She had expended too much aura simply trying, and failing she noted, not to be tossed around, and so was forced to claim out of the pit by hand.
When she finally pulled herself out, she took a moment to catch her breath before looking at her surroundings.
She was very confused by what she saw at first but as time passed a sense of urgency began to grow within her as understanding donned on her.
1123311222212222131211111.title: We check on Weiss who has been flung someplace ...
