choices: The anomaly releases a burt of energy , tuning her into a Gigant!
11233112222122221312111111.content:
This was impossible.
This was simply impossible.
Weiss had found herself in the middle of what she recognized as one of the many forests of the frozen continent of Solitas, home of the nation of atlas.
Already, she could feel the frigid winds chill her to the bone and with her being deprived of any kind of clothing that was not a good thing in the slightest.
Fortunately for her though, she had recovered enough of her aura to cast dust spells. With her trusty rapier Myrtenaster in hand, Her first course of action was to use ice dust in oder to make a makeshift igloo. Then she channeled some fire dust to light a bonfire she made using a bunch of wooden logs and sticks she found.
The schnee heiress had spent the next couple of hours simply trying to stay warm and thinking about the events that lead her here.
A part of her wanted to hate her teammates for putting her in this mess, especially Ruby, but she simply couldn't bring herself to do so. It's not as though it was any of their faults that they were born to be towering super humans, as far as she knew of course, and it was she that insisted that she partake in the activity dispite the many warnings that it was beyond her.

Weiss stared at the dancing flames of the bonfire deep in thought.
Suddenly, the snowy girl grit her teeth before swinging her weapon wildly and yelling in a fit of rage, hacking apart the igloo and cutting down a few trees in the process.
She then pounded her fist into the ground and let out a frustrated howl.
“It isn't fair” the cold scion said to herself, her voice cracking with emotion when she did.
All her life she has had to fight for everything she has, had to constantly act the part of the perfect heir, had to work her ass off just to be acknowledged and respected ,to be seen as “Weiss” and not simply “the schnee Heiress”.

Where as}“They”{/b, the Gigants, practically rule the world simply by existing.
Angry tears started to run down her face, everything she had experienced during the last couple of hours ( or weeks if you take the time dilation into account) all catching up with her at once.
She wanted so badly to show everyone that she wasn't someone to take lightly, to not be looked down on, that she had what it took to make it to the top. But deep down she knew that to be a virtually insurmountable task.
If only there was a way for her to close the gap between her and her teammates if only even a little bit.
As the naked and freezing young woman struggled with her feelings of inferiority, the strangest of sounds caught her ears.
It Was a strange humming sound that was halfway through radio static and muted thunder.
Weiss decided to leave the warmth of her igloo to investigate this strange disturbance.
As she approached, the sound grew louder and louder, filling her with a potent sense of trepidation.
When she finally reached the source, she was greeted by a most astonishing sight.
A strange anomaly, like a wound in the universe, hovered before the apprehensive huntress.
It shimmered and rippled like the surface of a body of water and tendrils of light seemed to pulsate softly at the edges like one of those plasma globes you'd find at an electronics store.
Weiss had no idea what she was looking at.
She knew that she should leave it alone or even alert the authorities, but something about the shimmering vortex drew her in, like it was calling out to her.
And so, against her better judgment and all commonsense, Weiss approached the wound and reached out....
11233112222122221312111111.title: A disparaging ice queen, a strange occurrence

112331122221222213121111112.content:
Weiss’s hand approached the object, the tear of sorts, as she looked on in mesmerized awe. She reached out to touch it, and felt energy wash over her and her eyes. And then she saw it.

She was a 65 foot tall Gigant, the same height as Jaune, with muscles big enough to lift mountains, breasts and a behind that would cause crowds of men to faint just from a slight shake, and the power to keep up with her teammates. She no longer had to be jealous of her teammates, or anyone. With their raw might, Team RWBY would be unstoppable, and Weiss Schnee would be considered the mightiest Huntress in the Schnee family, especially with it being primarily composed of mere little people.

Her smile went from ear to ear. Her muscles danced with anticipation to show off their near limitless might.

Before she could do anything with her new body, however, the light faded, and she was back to normal. The same tiny, weak, Weiss that was tossed around like a leaf in the wind by her colossal teammates.

“NO!” She yelled, although no one seemed to hear it. “It’s not fair! I don’t want revenge, I just want to be big! Stupid thing! Make me big! Make me big!”

Tears went down her eyes as she looked on at where the weird tear used to be, wondering what it was and what it showed her. It was her deepest desire, not to be superior to her teammates, but to be an equal among them. Sighing heavily, Weiss was ready to return to her igloo and rest before she looked on her body.

She was clothed.

More notably, she was clothed in her normal outfit, rather than anything unrecognizable. While the warmth her clothing provided was more than welcome, she was now more confused than anything. Heading back to shelter, she began to try and put things together.

——————

“I’m not hallucinating, otherwise this wouldn’t be here,” Weiss said aloud, holding her dress. “But that...thing showed me as a Gigant! A pretty good looking one too,” she said smugly, before returning to her task at hand. “But how?”

With the idea of her hallucinating rejected, Weiss began to ponder the alternatives, no matter how bizarre or seemingly impossible. This tear, distortion, or whatever it was showed a reality where she had her desire fulfilled. But when it closed, the energy returned her to a “default”, namely what she looked like when others described her, down to the exact dimensions of her uniform.

If she continued to find tears, she concluded that it could be more likely that it would edge her closer and closer from what her reality was to what her reality wanted her to be in that deep desire, a Gigant able to keep up with her friends as they grew in power and size.

This was all hypothetical though. For all she knew, touching the next tear would turn her into dust, or shift reality in a way that wouldn’t be to her favor, like taking away her clothes, or sending her somewhere completely isolated. But that wasn’t going to stop her. She left the igloo and traveled, looking for another tear like the one she found. Weiss knew that it was there, and that if she found it, she would have the body she saw in that brief flash. Time had faded into the background as Weiss lost track of how long she was walking. Her feet ached, her teeth chattered, and her fingers began to go slightly numb, but her mind pushed forward. A Gigant would weather this storm effortlessly, and so would she. She would her find her goal, the Snow Fairy would become the Frost Giantess.

Finally, as she walked over a hill, she came upon something.
112331122221222213121111112.title: A taste of power

choices: Weiss found a third one inside
1123311222212222131211111121.content:
As Weiss got to the top of the hill, all she saw was a massive whiteout heading her way. With the weather increasingly getting harsher, Weiss swallow her pride and start to walk back to the igloo.

By the time she started to see it in her line of sight, the whiteout has already started to cover her. She try to pick up her pace but, she was too cold to go any faster. By the time she got back to the igloo, she was shivering cold and almost out of energy.

When she saw the igloo that she made, there were two more tears in space on either side of it.
1123311222212222131211111121.title: It’s another tear

choices: Weiss is able to reach the tear before she can be stopped
Weiss attempts to reach the tear, but is stopped by the military forces there
Something happens to the tear before she can reach it.
1123311222212222131211111123.content:
Looking out in front of her, Weiss saw what looked to be a town. She groaned slightly, wondering if her trek was for nothing, before reasoning that at least the town would have a place to eat and something to call Beacon and let them know where she was. That was if there was anything left of the facility, despite every building being reinforced to handle the power of Gigants, what she had witnessed seemed so far beyond anything little people could handle.

As she headed into town however, she saw that there was a good amount of commotion on the road. It looked like numerous people, scientists, soldiers, and the like all looked on at something in the middle of the road. She wondered if there was a way to get close to it when she felt her dress and realized that she had some spare money in it. Doing her best to avoid the crowds, she walked into a small restaurant several blocks from the commotion and ordered a large coffee and a small danish, something to recharge after the trip and give her a reason to discuss what had happened.

“Here’s your order, Miss,” the waitress, a woman in her forties with brunette hair and a slight accent said. “You with the crew over that weird thing in town?”

Weird thing? Could it be one of the tears?

“I’m a freelancer,” Weiss said. “Handling assignments for Hunters between classes. I got a call about something weird in town and was told to come over, but they didn’t say what.”

“I don’t know the science or whatnot, but they said it was some sort of dimensional tear. All I know is that when it did show up a few of the cars next to it vanished.”

It was the tear! And her ticket to becoming a Gigant!

“Well I’d better go see it before all the fun is over,” Weiss said, only for the woman to shake her head.

“They didn’t give you any ID?”

“No.”

“Well then good luck getting near there! I had to take the long way around work because of all the soldiers on patrol! Only thing missing was one of them Gigant people.”

“Eh, they’re overrated,” Weiss said as she finished the last of her coffee and paid the waitress for the meal. Walking outside, she quickly slipped into an alleyway and leapt to a rooftop.

The waitress was correct, as there were tons of Atlas military personnel along with several people in what appeared to be hazmat suits observing the tear with instruments, but daring to not touch it. They probably had no idea what they were dealing with, but Weiss knew. The problem now was trying to get to the tear and touching it without being shot by the guys with guns. On the plus side, the lack of any Gigants made this a much easier assignment than it would have been otherwise.

“OK Weiss,” she said to no one in particular, “you can do this. Just gotta get to the tear, and with any luck, you’ll grow to Gigant size. Just need to get to it without getting shot. You’ve got this.”
1123311222212222131211111123.title: It’s a town

choices: Weiss made it to the tear
11233112222122221312111111233.content:
As Weiss made her way to the strange tear using the side streets and any cover she could in the main streets, it was getting a bit difficult to get to it. Just before she got to it, Weiss made a circle around it to see if there was any easier way to get to it. It wasn’t make any different, it was going to a force of nature or an aerial entrance to get to it.

Climbing the tallest building carefully, Weiss looked down at her goal and was surprised at what she saw. Her sister was there and was right by the tear.

Moving a bit back, Weiss sprint off the roof and ...
11233112222122221312111111233.title: Something happens to the tear before she can re...

choices: Weiss is able to get past her sister and reach the tear
Winter attacks Weiss to protect the tear
One of the soldiers calls for backup, Gigant sized Penny
112331122221222213121111112332.content:
Weiss’ grimace covered her face. Of all the people to be guarding the square, it was her sister! Not only was she an incredibly skilled Huntress, her presence would alert her family to her involuntary hooky. And for what? ‘No Winter, really, touching the space and time anomaly will make me a Gigant and infinitely more powerful than before, which I need before a training exercise sends me somewhere I won’t return from? Yeah, she’s bound to believe that. No, she still had to grab the tear and hope against hope it made her a Gigant. The power to keep up with her friends was so close and she wasn’t going to give it up.

————————

“A rip in space and time, Doctor?”

A scruff man with a beard nodded at the tall, for a little person woman. “Yes, and not the only one we’ve seen, but the one in the most public area. Apparently 18 or so hours ago, a massive exertion of physical force near Beacon Academy resulted in this happening. Whatever did it seemed to wipe the surrounding forest away as smooth as glass before these tears formed.”

“What could have such power to do that? Was there a terrorist attack? A military action?”

“Beacon has a fairly large population of Gigants, and yesterday, pretty much every Gigant on the planet seemed to more than double in size and muscle mass. You know how destructive a single Gigant can be with their Aura, now more than double that and add several in the same area. They are walking weapons of mass destruction.”

“That’s...absurd,” the white haired woman said. “And Beacon itself?”

“The academy and the surrounding town were built to Gigant specifications and apparently weathered the storm, although more construction is being done to repair the damage. I swear, Gigant construction workers are making a small fortune with all the demand for their services. You know a Gigant put my local...”

“Task at hand Doctor,” the woman replied. “How do we get rid of this safety?”

“Well that’s the good news. All it requires is a fairly potent charge of negative ions to counteract the presence of the tear and it should close up before doing any more damage. Although I did want to observe its effect on the local...”

The train of thought was interrupted by the sound of gunfire as soldiers began firing at a figure moving along the rooftops, using skill and glyphs to move through the hail of bullets. Winter grimaced.

“What’s going on?”

Looking closer, she recognized the assailant, and was visibly confused.

“Weiss?”

————————————

So far, so good. Weiss was quickly moving from one rooftop to another, dodging and incapacitating soldiers with her semblance as she got closer and closer to her prize. She could feel it. She could taste it.

“Weiss! Hold it right there!”

The Schnee heiress grimaced at the sight of her sister, but paid her no mind. She continued her relentless leaps towards her prize, only to find that her sister was standing guard in front of it, sword at the ready.

“Are you insane? What are you even doing here?”

“I can’t explain,” Weiss said. “I just need to get to that tear!”
112331122221222213121111112332.title: Weiss made it to the tear

1123311222212222131211111123321.content:
Thinking fast, Weiss pulled out two dust crystals, one energy and one fire, and activated them together, creating a makeshift flashbang grenade which she chucked into the air. The light that was generated blinded everyone in the immediate vicinity except for Weiss who had the good sense to shield her eyes.
Winter let out a loud yelp as she recoiled from the flash, Completely dropping her guard along with every other soldier present.
It was now or never.
In a brilliant display of acrobatics, the heiress launched herself into the air with one of her glyphs and somersaulted over every soldier and barricade directly in front of the tear.
Weiss took a moment to gaze at her prize.
This shimmering vortex of possibilities had the potential to either grant her greatest wish or completely destroy her.
For the briefest of micro seconds the ambitious young woman contemplated on whether or not this course of action was worth it.
The memory of being tossed about like a mote of dust and her time in “The Void" screamed Yes.
Without a second thought, the ice princess reached out with her hand and made contact with the anomaly.
The tear seemed to ripple for a moment before releasing a powerful burst of energy that violently pushed everything around away from it and engulf everything in a brilliant explosion of light.

-------00000-------

Weiss felt strange, to say the least, as though she was submerged in water though she could still breathe.
A quick observation of her surroundings revealed that she was floating in some manner of starry space.
A spark of panic swept through her mind at the prospect of having damned herself to be banished to another void but was dosed by a mysterious warmth.
It was like she was wrapped in a comfortable blanket that caused all of her worries to melt away.
She spent a few seconds simply enjoying the feeling until a twinkle in the distance caught her attention.
One of the stars in this twilight flickered and pulsed on the horizon. Becoming more and more erratic until it appeared to be wobbling. Then without warning, the point of like shot off like a bullet at incredible speeds, resembling a shooting star as it streaked across the skyline. The star zigzagged and twirled through the air in a dazzling array of intricate patterns.
The Frigid huntress stared at the display in amazement, she could look at it all day and never one get tired of it.
The star would then suddenly stop, confusing the snowy girl for a moment.
“What’s happening now?” She thought to herself in concern.
Then as suddenly as it had stopped, it rocketed forward at even greater speeds than before directly towards Weiss's position.
In a panic, the icy young woman crossed her arms over her face and braced for impact.
Two seconds pass ,Then another five with nothing happening.
Confused, the icy huntress slowly opened her eyes and dropped her guard to see what was up.

A ball of intense light no bigger than a softball hung in the air in front of her.
The orb irradiated a prismatic Corona of tiny hair-like tendrils from its core that seemed to dance against the darkened backdrop of this twilit plane.
It was all so breathtaking.
Right before the she could reach out to touch it, the orb suddenly shot forward, striking her in her torso and was seemingly absorbed into her body .
A Feeling of pure ecstasy pulsed through her body as she became filled with an energy she had never known before.
She felt as though power was being funneled into her very being, like her very essence was being super charged. It was so intense that she almost came right then and there.
Just as suddenly as it began, the surge halted and the Heiress was left panting where she stood.
She felt….stronger. significantly stronger.
It was more than that. She also felt like there was….MORE of her somehow.
After regaining her composure, the icy young woman took a moment to appraise herself.
Her clothes were stretched taunt over muscles that weren't there before. She had the build of a well seasoned amateur body builder, every square inch of musculature was sculpted to perfection and seemed to dance with unbridled power.

The girl flexed her left arm experimentally and watched in undisguised awe as her bicep seemed to dance beneath the sleeves of her jacket.
A wide smile broke across the Heiress's face.
She started to giggle to herself .
Her giggling eventually grew into full blown maniacal laughter as she came to realize what this place was.
In that moment, every star in this space began to flicker just like the one before.
These were not “ stars" like she had initially thought.
They were Possibilities!
Weiss gazed dramatically at the skyline with a confident smirk on her face.

“Come to me!” the Schnee heiress declared with a commanding voice.
In response, all the lights in this starry realm rush towards her at once, all of them slamming into her body and being assimilated by it.
The sheer ecstasy she felt in that moment could not be described in mere words.
It felt as though every cell in her body was being suffused with the energy of a million suns all being funneled into her at once.
Unending screams of pure rapturous pleasure tore out as she came ceaselessly, each climax better and more powerful than the last.
Her body grew brighter and brighter as seemingly boundless power flooded into it until a massive explosion of light rushed outwards in all directions, consuming the entire space.

-------00000-------

Back outside in the square, Winter was picking herself off the ground, having been thrown bodily through the air When the anomaly violently collapsed.
The hardened woman spit up some dirt that got in her mouth.
What was that stupid little girl thinking!
Not only was she apparently playing hooky, an action the older schnee sibling would never expect from the academically minded girl, But also violated the boundaries of a clearly restricted area.
“when I get my hands on you”

The army woman's train of thought was interrupted when she noticed that a large shadow had been cast on the area.
Confused, the serious minded woman raised her head to see what was going on and was immediately floored by what she witnessed.
In the middle of the square stood a truly massive form where there wasn't one before.
A Gigant.
And a female one at that, if the truly outrageous curves they sported were any indication, they had a pair of breasts twice as large as their head and a posterior to match which framed by very wide hips.
By the military woman's best estimate, the Gigant stood somewhere in the ballpark of 65 feet tall, most of it coming from its perfectly sculpted legs.

She also noticed that the giant was wearing nothing but a flowery white bra and a pair of underwear of the same design.
Winter couldn't help but blush at the sight.
So many thoughts about who this person was and where they came from buzzed through her mind at once.
When she finally got a good look at the Gigant's face, her blood ran cold.

“Weiss?”
1123311222212222131211111123321.title: Weiss's ascension

choices: She uses her semblance to summon a massive nevermore and rides back to beacon
11233112222122221312111111233211.content:
Weiss felt incredible!
Nigh limitless strength and energy seemed to burst out from her every pore.
She flexed both of her mighty arms and marveled at their hulking mass.
Looking down at herself, she saw to her immense delight that her vision was obstructed by two of the largest knockers she had ever seen!
The frost giantess turned to look down behind herself and, sure enough, her butt had gotten the same treatment. She gave it a little shake followed by a playful smack, she giggled as she watched substantial globes jiggle slightly.
The aspiring huntress began to shamelessly grope herself out in the open, squeezing and rubbing down every nook and cranny of magnificent new form, her face was a visage of pure bliss.
In the back of her mind, she did realize that she was literally in nothing but her underwear but at this point she was beyond caring.
It's better than being butt naked she supposed.
The thing that was really getting her going was her new perspective.
She towered over everything she saw, it made her feel like she was one of those goddesses depicted on ancient stone tablets.
The rush. The power. It was intoxicating!!!
Is this how her friends feel all the time?
If that's the case it's no wonder Ruby always acts the way she does.

She began laughing out loud causing the entire town and the surrounding forest shake violently in the process, she was still very new to being a Gigant and would have to be far more conscious of her actions from now on .

A new sense of freedom and fulfillment began to wash over the frosty giantess.
Nothing and no one could stop her now.
With this new found power, she now had complete control over her destiny.
And best of all? She could finally keep up with her friends!
No longer would she be tossed around like a plastic wrapper in the wind as her teammates threw their weight around.
She could finally say that she was their equal.

Yes. Things were finally looking up for Weiss!
at this point, the new born Gigant didn't think anything could bring down her mood.

“ Weiss?”

Except that.

The snowy Titaness slowly turned her head downwards to meet the gaze a very confused older sister.

“What happened to you?”

In a panic, the Gigant crouched down, readying herself to jump.

“ Wait!” was all the army woman could say before her now giant little sister kicked off the ground with incredible force, the sonic boom that was produced blowing away everything from the point of take off.
Fortunately for winter, she was able to erect a warding glyph before the shockwave hit.
As she saw the silhouette of her “little” sister's form disappear over the horizon, she couldn't help but feel a sense of dread worm it's way into her heart.

“What is going on?”


-------00000-------

Somewhere out in the middle of the frozen wilderness hundreds of miles away from the town, a massive object slams into the earth at an incredible velocity, the resulting explosion produced by the impact upended half of the surrounding forest.
At the bottom of the crater that was formed, the half naked hulking form of the schnee heiress could be seen kneeling down.
Suddenly, the white haired giantess fell upon her massive rump and placed her face in her hands.

How could she have forgotten about winter!?
And she ran away!?
Weiss groaned into the palms of her hands, already feeling a migraine from the inevitable verbal beat down would get from her sister coming on.

Still though.
She could say that she was too upset , considering the fact she finally had everything she wanted.
Standing up to her full 65 foot height, the frost giantess dusted herself off and began to consider her next course of action.
11233112222122221312111111233211.title: Weiss's ascension Continued

choices: It’s Ruby and the others, happy and surprised to see her
It’s Winter and some Atlas soldiers, aw hell
112331122221222213121111112332111.content:
Weiss’ first priority was fairly simple, get her bigger butt back to Beacon ASAP. But how? Even with her new body, jumping there would take quite a while, not to mention the obvious trail of destruction would make it fairly easy for Winter to catch her and chew her ear out. She needed a ride.

“Ride...that’s it!”

Weiss began to focus on her semblance, but as she did so, she felt a level of Aura beyond anything she had ever felt before. It had gone from a water fountain to a waterfall of power, the endless wellspring of power explaining how Ruby and the others could literally reshape the planet as if it were clay. So lost was she in the intoxicating feeling of power that she hadn’t realized what she had summoned.

It was a Nevermore, a bird of magnificent length, at one point the most terrifying of Grimm that she had ever seen, a beast that in past generations blotted the skies with its wingspan and required groups of Hunters to even bring down one. Its sharp talons and thick hide was the stuff of legends, and the mere appearance of one was enough for towns to empty. The few men and women who killed them in generations before had songs sung of their valor and power. Weiss remembered how effortlessly Ruby had bought one down, the first proof that the Gigants were going to completely change power balance of the world.

The Nevermore stood in Weiss the size of a horse. A horse with wings, but a horse all the same, and her quickest way back to Beacon.

“Good girl,” Weiss said to the summoned beast, stroking its head as if it were a mere pet. “We’ve got a journey ahead of us, and thanks to you, no one is going to miss seeing the new, bigger me.”

Plopping her enormous behind on the creature’s firm backside, Weiss marveled as the Nevermore flapped its wings, the power causing wind gusts to form and blowing over everything in its path for miles. It was always a power to be marveled at, but Weiss grinned. That power was now hers to wield.

“Let’s go girl!”

With a magnificent swing of its wings, the beast took to the skies, it and it’s Gigant rider heading right for Beacon academy. Weiss couldn’t help but cheer in excitement, the power of her voice echoing throughout the skies and shredding a nearby flock of birds. This raw power would take a lot of getting used to.

———————————-

Day had turned into night as Ruby and the others headed back to Beacon, unable to find Weiss. They knew she was physically okay, Ruby’s durability semblance would see to that, but the fact that the little “snow fairy” was missing couldn’t help but rub them the wrong way.

“We shouldn’t have let Weiss come with us,” Ruby said, her and the others having put on new pairs of clothes to replace the ones that were atomized during their sparring session. Pyrrha had left to go on an assignment with her own team, but reassured the leader of Team RWBY that their friend was going to be fine.

“It was her choice to come with us,” Blake replied with a matter-of-fact tone. “She thought she could keep with us, she couldn’t, and now she has to deal with the consequences.”

“Yeah,” Yang added, “it’s almost more insulting if we treated her like fine china. We can’t baby other members of the team...”

“She’s not a baby,” Ruby said, defensive of her little friend, “she’s just...confused.”

“You’re worrying too much Rubes. It’ll work out.”

Ruby nodded, but couldn’t help but feel some guilt at what had occurred. She thought it would be funny to make one of the team normal sized, but at this point, given the raw power her and the other Gigants now wielded, it was starting to feel just plain mean keeping Weiss small. Maybe she should make her a Gigant.

That train of thought was quickly put to one side as a massive shadow headed for Beacon, one the girls recognized easily.

“A Nevermore?”

“Well, guess the day’s not done yet girls!” Yang said, eager to take the creature down. But before she could do so, she noticed that the beast was being ridden.

“Someone’s on it!”

Looking at the creature, Ruby felt a sense of relief, a sense of confusion, and a sense of pride all at the same time. It came out in one word.

“Weiss?”

———————————

“Beacon! I’m back! And I’m bigger and better than ever!” Weiss said aloud to no one in particular. She was reveling in her newfound power and couldn’t wait to show the others her pet. Finding a clearing for her Nevermore, the enormous winged Grimm set itself down, as she waited to see who would greet them.
112331122221222213121111112332111.title: The sleeper has awakened

choices: Morning comes and the girls explain Weiss’ growth to the staff
Morning comes, and Winter is there with Atlas forces to confront Weiss
1123311222212222131211111123321111.content:
The majestic beast landed itself in a clearing where its flaps created winds forceful enough to send anything by it that wasn’t a Gigant or reinforced to the standards of one flying. Landing from the beast and causing the ground to quake from the force, Weiss still marveled at her raw power. It was going to be a bit before she was used to her new stature. Emerging into the clearing to see what had landed were three very familiar sights, which made her smile.

“Weiss? Is that you? You’re...”

“Bigger and better, Ruby!” Weiss answered, going into a classic double bicep pose as her massive pectorals danced for the group. Blake wore a look of confusion, Yang whistled slightly at the display of power, but Ruby immediately ran and embraced the still smaller girl in a hug that would have turned the regular sized Weiss into powder.

“Weiss! You’re okay! I was so worried! I shou...”

“Ruby, it’s fine, really”, Weiss said, her voice sincere and her tone reassuring. “I was the one who asked, and well, it looks like it worked out pretty well.”

“Uh, yeah,” Blake interrupted, causing the two girls to separate. “That’s great and all, but...how?!”

“How what?”

“How did you gain sixty feet and how many tons of muscle?”

“Can we discuss it over dinner?” Weiss asked. “I could use some food, and a change of clothes.”

“I don’t think any of your old outfits will fit,” Yang joked, “but I guess you can borrow one of mine until we can go shopping tomorrow. You’re going to have to go barefoot though.”

“You know?” Weiss said. “I don’t think it’s that big a deal.” The Nevermore vanished as quickly as it was summoned, leaving the four girls to discuss what had happened to their friend.

***************************

After a brief stop in the dorm room, during which Weiss thankfully found some clothes to put on, the group went off to dinner. Blake’s questions were on the hows and why’s of the whole affair, but Weiss merely responded to all of them with an “I’m not sure.”

“Not sure.”

“Well, yes, but also no,” Weiss said. “You see, when we fell into the hole, the force of all your auras seemed to split the fabric of reality apart and change things in the area, it was so powerful. I just remembered getting knocked out, and when I woke up I was thousands of miles away, with well, these” she said, giggling as she held her gigantic breasts aloft. “I’ve gotta get used to this new center of gravity.”

She didn’t want to reveal the existence of the tears just yet for fear that others would try to duplicate what she had done, or worse yet, undo them. Ruby didn’t seem to mind, but Weiss was unaware her transformation had merely done something she had pondered doing herself. Blake nodded at the explanation, perfectly aware of just how much force the girls had exerted prior, but wondering if there was anything missing between the time Weiss fell asleep and the time she woke up.

The four were the only ones eating in the dining room, with most of Beacon busy in the aftermath of the cataclysmic battle earlier. The buildings were all built to Gigant specifications, but the constant literal expansion of their student body, particularly on such a massive scale, led to classes being cancelled and construction sped up to make sure everyone had enough space. Gigant construction crews were a constant presence on campus, with students working for crews as an easy way to make tuition money.

“I can’t believe I need all of this,” Weiss said as she ravenously dug into the food in front of her. “I think just a tiny bit of this would have been a feast for the old me.”

“Big girls, big muscles,” Yang joked as she flexed a bicep. “Gotta keep em fed.”

“Speaking of,” Blake asked, “do the staff know? I’m sure once everyone sees how tall you’ve gotten, they’re going to have questions. A lot of them.”

“Well, I’m sure we can help out with that,” Ruby said. “Maybe we can come up with an explanation for her. You saw what happened out there, for all we know, Weiss got split between space and time and came out...improved.”

“I’m glad you like what you see,” Weiss said with a joking tone, “but if you could help with the explanations, I would appreciate it.”

“OK, then it’s settled. First thing in the morning, we go explain everything, and then we’re all set! Team RWBY is going to be unstoppable!”

Weiss cheered, an uncharacteristic action prior to her growth, but she soon covered her mouth when she realized her voice shook the ground.

“Sorry. I’m not used to that yet.”

“You learn,” Blake said reassuringly.
1123311222212222131211111123321111.title: It’s Ruby and the others

choices: We follow the girls around the campus
11233112222122221312111111233211111.content:
Tomorrow had come and the four members of team RWBY
Stood in front of the door to director Ozpin's office.
Weiss felt a sense of trepidation fall upon her and she became lost in thought, how was she going to sell them on the idea that she had become a Gigant without telling them about the tears?
The newborn Gigant was ripped from her trance when she felt a large hand fall upon her shoulder.
Weiss looked up to see the reassuring gaze of her leader showing her that she and the rest of team RWBY had her back.
Weiss gave the scarlet colossus a soft smile before turning to face the door with a look of resolve in her eyes.
It was all going to be okay. She was sure of it.
The team stepped forward to meet whatever awaited them head on.

The office of Beacon's enigmatic director was quite similar to its pre reality warp counterpart with the exception of being significantly larger in order to allow room for Gigant students to enter.
In it's center, stood a greatly elevated platform with a tastefully designed “little person" scaled desk and assortment of file cabinets , which they assumed correctly belonged to the dean, that sat snugly on top of it.
Sitting at the desk was the eccentric man himself alongside a very P.O.ed looking Glynda Goodwitch who immediately started glaring daggers at the four giant woman the moment they entered.
It was a testament to the woman's steely reputation that she was able to intimidate people multiple stories taller than her with a look.
Weiss regained her composure and began to speak.
“ you wanted to see me sir?”
Ozpin was looking over school reports on some holographic laptop while nursing a cup of his favorite brand of coffee before meeting the gigantic young woman's eyes.

“ It would seem that the rumors of you somehow randomly turning into a Gigant were true after all.” The man took another swig of his coffee, making sure to take his time savoring the flavor.

Weiss looked very uncomfortable with this whole situation.
“It would appear so sir.”
The frost giantess appeared to find the floor very interesting.
“I see.”
Ozpin took one more sip of his coffee before setting down and placing his hands together.

“And might I inquire how such an incredible transformation came about?”

The studious Girl was suddenly gripped with fear and apprehension.
No one could know of her encounter with the tears.
If they do they might try to turn her back to being “widdle Weiss”.
Her thoughts flashed to the “Void".

Never again.

“ When we were having our sparring match, at some point near the end, my teammates auras clash and, I guess, super charged me?” the troubled girl said that last sentence with a bit of uncertainty in her voice.

The man the towering young woman a look that he could tell something was fishy.
“ Are sure that there aren't any details you've omitted” the Man had begun to say.
“ NO!” Weiss shouted more forcefully than she intended resulting in the various windows and glass objects to crack slightly and rendering both Glynda and himself into disheveled states. Eccentric man frowned at the sight of his coffee cup springing a leak from the cracks that had formed and Glynda

The Snowy giantess visibly grimaced at the sight and how her friends all wore looks of concern for their comrade.
“I-I mean no sir…” she said in a far more subdued volume.

Ozpin for his part took the whole thing in stride. Without skipping a beat, the well dressed man put away his damaged mug and pulled out a new one from seemingly thin air. He took a big whiff of the magnificent life sustaining black ambrosia before taking another sips.
“ Well considering how little we have to go on in this situation, that answer's as good as any.”
The Headmaster then donned a serious look.
“ But be warned. We are going to be keeping a very close eye on you for the foreseeable future.”
He set his mug down on the table.
“Is that understood?”

The Heiress swallowed a lump that had been forming in her throat.

“C-Crystal sir.” She stuttered out quickly.

The Eccentric man’s calm demeanor returned to his face and posture.
“ Then it's settled then ,for now at least. I have nothing more to say on the matter.”

Weiss and co. Excused themselves from the room, relief evident in their body language, and were about to make their leave only to be stopped in their tracks when the head master halted them.
“upupup, I may be done on the subject of Ms schnee’s bizarre metamorphosis but there is still the matter of this morning’s activities.”
Ozpin then turned towards his assistant.

“ Glynda. If you may?”

The stern woman gave a curt nod before placing a truly thick stack of papers.

“ This is a list of all the repair bills that have been incurred as a result of your “sparring match”. She said that last part with a little bit of edge to her voice causing the four huntresses to move around uncomfortably in their spots.
“ the entire super structure of the building essentially has to be completely replaced.
Both gas and water lines have to swapped out and the power grid needs to be replaced as well.
And the dormitories basically have to be built back up from scratch.”
The woman looked up from the papers to look the four girls directly in the eyes.
The girls really didn't like where this was going.
“And those were for just the school grounds. The city of vale had sent us a bill today that would give you all nightmares! Untold levels of property damage had been sustained by the city and perhaps even the entire country, if all the news Reports are accurate, and Beacon is being held accountable!

The girls had the decency to look ashamed. They really didn't consider the consequences of their battle.

Ruby was the first to speak.

“We were Just-"

Glynda raised her hand, silencing the Gigantic student.

“ I don’t want to hear your reasons or your excuses. I had thought you all were better disciplined on how to control your strength but it seems I had misjudged you.”

The combat professor pulled out her riding crop and started pointing it at them.

“ First you will all write a one thousand paragraph essay reflecting on your poor decisions
Than you will all make a public apology to the entire campus and city. And finally you will be spending all of your free time for the foreseeable future helping repair the damages you caused and when you're not doing that you will be in your rooms studying and working on the extra homework assignments you will given.”

The woman swung her riding crop down with a powerful flick.
“Do I make myself clear?”

The girls all nodded in unison.
“Yes ma'am.”
Glynda sighed and turned her back to the girls.
“Then you are dismissed. Be thankful that this is all your getting.
After the stunt you pulled, you all are getting off easy.”
As the girl's turned to leave, the hard minded professor spoke up one more time.
“Oh and please tell Ms Nikos that these goes for her as well when she gets back from her assignment.”
When the door to the office shut, the no-nonsense woman pinched the bridge of her nose and let out an exasperated sigh.
This whole situation was insane.
She turned toward her boss / leader.
“You sure know how to pickem.”
Ozpin let out a small chuckle at hearing this.
“I guess I do don't I.” he took another swig of his beloved brew.

Glynda stared out the cracked window at the cityscape on the horizon.
“Do you think they will be able to make a difference against her?”
Opzin had an unreadable expression on his face as he stared down at his reflection in the mug.
“Only time will tell.”


---------0000-----------

Back in their makeshift dorm rooms , the girls were mulling over today's events.
“Well. This sucks" Yang said Bluntly.
Blake was currently working on her weapon to take her mind off things.
“ Can't say we don't deserve it though.” The cat faunus responded sagely.

Yang blew a piece of hair from her from her face.
“Your probably right…”

The Blonde brawler turned to face her newly Gigantized friend.
“So what was that all about? You look like you were about to seriously freak out.”
Weiss sat up from her impromptu bed as though she was startled.
“I-I was nothing! Really! Was just worried about getting in trouble with the Headmaster that's all!”
She then regained some semblance of composure before continuing to speak.
“ So what should we do first on our list?” Weiss asked her teammates, trying to change the subject, an action that did not go unnoticed by Ruby.

The crimson haired colossus took a second to think before answering.
“We should probably help with repairs around the school before turning in.”
The rest of the team nodded at that suggestion and got up to begin working

Meanwhile Ruby began pondering what to do next….
11233112222122221312111111233211111.title: A really tall tale.

112331122221222213121111112332111112.content: We check in on Ozpin as he receives a message from ironwood.
112331122221222213121111112332111112.title: Something else

1123311222212222131211111123321111122.content: We fast forward to tomorrow where the members of team RWBY help their icy friend find new clothes that fit her size.
1123311222212222131211111123321111122.title: Shopping

choices: The girls continue to shop for clothes for Weiss
A call comes in from the campus
Weiss gets a calf from Winter
11233112222122221312111111233211111221.content:
Exhaustion permeated throughout the muscles of all four girls as they walked off from the sit,e their shift finally ended. The construction crews had taken addition of four Gigants volunteering and set them to work on reconstruction efforts that didn’t require any sort of delicate training. That meant lifting a lot of bricks, lifting a lot of metal, and letting the more experienced workers handle things like welding and tool use. When their shift was done for the day, the girls walked off as the soreness permeated every single fiber of muscle. Weiss, in particular, was dealing with a crash course in using her new size and power to help out, but the sheer workload kept her from thinking about it too heavily until she went back to the dorm to clean herself up and saw her old area of the dorm, which she could now hold in her hand like a play set.

“To think, I used to sleep here.”

“You’re a Gigant now,” Ruby said with a beaming grin. “You’re big enough to eat off this thing! Embrace it!” She smiled at the scarlet huntress, then looked on at her clothes.

“Yeah, which reminds me, I need to go get my new clothes.”

“Getting off of campus would do us some good,” Blake said. And with that, the four headed off to the store. The mood was fairly optimistic given the exhaustion being felt and the sight of people working to repair the damage that was laid bare by the girls and their practice session. Saying that Ruby underestimated the sheer unmitigated might that she now possessed was a gross understatement. Next time, she had to use her semblance to do something like contain the damage in a limited space. As it stood now, she had made her mistake and had to live with it, not wanting to try and change the circumstances with her semblance and potentially create new problems.

Weiss, for her part, seemed to take to her new scale rather quickly. When on the way, a group of little people complimented her arms, her reaction was to flex a gigantic bicep in front of the group, before thanking them for the compliment. She was less enthusiastic when someone from the campus asked about Weiss’ old size, the frost giantess clearly uncomfortable with the subject as she gave a few little details before changing the subject. It was something the others all noticed, but none of them pressed it further for the moment.

Soon enough, the group had reached the clothing store, and Weiss was trying on a variation of the Gigant uniform with a white and silver trim, with black shorts. Flexing as she took in the sight of her new body in the outfit, the Gigant grinned.

“It’s a good look for me, wouldn’t you say? Really shows off my body.”

“And here I thought you’d be a bit more...conservative,” Yang said, but Weiss was quick to shake her head.

“No way! That was old, ‘wittle Weiss’! Big Weiss has big things to show off!”

“Hey, if you’re comfortable,” Yang said, “then you wear it.” 
“That sounds like a plan to me!” The whole while, Blake nodded, but her doubt about the situation and Weiss’ actions continued to ring in her head. It was clear that there was something missing here, or maybe the exhaustion that was only starting to subside was messing with their heads.
11233112222122221312111111233211111221.title: Shopping for Weiss

112331122221222213121111112332111112211.content:
Team RWBY continue their shopping trip to get Weiss some decent Gigant’s clothes. By the time their were at the last shop, Weiss chimed, “It’s a shame that they don’t make dresses from Gigants,” as she got a handle on her voice volume through the day as a frown appeared to form.

“Whatcha you expect,” Yang said to Weiss’s comment, “the bigger you are, the more fabric they has to use to keep us decent. And I thought you like being BIGGER now,” Yang said as she was flexing her mighty bicep.

“It not that,” Weiss finally realized that being bigger has it’s limitations, “I’m glad I can finally share being this big with you guy,” as she grab some different styles of tops and head towards the dressing room.

As Weiss was heading to the dressing room, she could hear Blake say to the others, “It seem like her high of being a Gigant is gone. Any...” was all she heard.

Opening the long curtain, the snowy giantess saw...
112331122221222213121111112332111112211.title: The girls continue to shop for clothes for Weiss

choices: Winter offers to negotiate that condition on her behalf.
Winter refuses.  Come to the site or else.
The girls overhear the conversation and have their own advice.
112331122221222213121111112332111112213.content:
An hour had passed, with Weiss showing off her figure in several new outfits designed for her Gigant form. Every time she tried one on, she flexed, posed, and in general put it through the paces to ensure that it would compliment her enhanced figure, something the old, demure Weiss would never do without being forced to. Soon enough, she had gathered a replacement wardrobe that would serve her for the immediate future and was on her way out of the store. Her friends seemed to be more open with her, discussing the things to watch out for not only with shopping for clothing, but general actions with her body, most notably how to control their voices to avoid damaging the area around them. Weiss took the advice with a keen ear and a smile, allowing the girls to explain anything they deemed important in detail. It felt like a barrier was removed between the group, the distance caused by their different scales now gone completely.

The group was all set to go get dinner when a call came in on a cell phone, Ruby’s to be particular. A bit surprised at this, she realized the person on the other end wasn’t calling her.

“Weiss? It’s for you. It’s...your sister.”

Weiss bit back a curse, but took the phone. “Could you give a few minutes?”

“Sure. Is there anything...”

“NO! Just...you know, sibling stuff. You know how it is.” With that, Weiss retreated to a corner to speak with her sister. Her heart weighed heavy as she knew exactly why she called.

“Hey.”

That’s all you have to say for yourself? Hey? How about ‘I’m sorry that I tried to skip out of class? I tapped into a power that scientists can’t understand and emerged 65 feet tall and covered head to toe in muscles?

“Look, Winter, it’s fine. I’m just...bigger now.”

Is that so? Then I suppose you won’t mind if Atlas scientists have a look at you.

“NO!” Weiss yelled, the noise loud enough to shake the ground and nearby buildings. Sighing at the unrestrained power of her voice, she repeated “No” more softly.

Weiss, what you did interfered with potential scientific breakthroughs and Atlas’ national security. I can try, key word, try to smooth things over, but if you don’t submit to examination, you will be taken by force. And I don’t care how big you’ve gotten or how much Aura you now have, Atlas WILL bring you in by any means necessary. I can only protect you for so long.

“You can’t take this away from me,” Weiss said, emotion clearly forming on her words. “It’s...”

You don’t want to be returned to normal?

“It’s...it’s complicated.”

Maybe, but my superiors demands are simple. You’re going to get a place to meet and to have experiments run on you. Some of those experiments may involve seeing if the process can be...

“I said no!”

You need to be reasonable. You did something that you weren’t supposed to do, and now you need to own up to the responsibilities of doing so. Further instructions will be coming. For your sake you had better not ignore them.

“Can you at least have them promise they won’t try to undo it? Please?” She was one step away from crying, finally having acquired the power to be equal to her friends, and only a day later, having someone threaten to take it completely away.
112331122221222213121111112332111112213.title: Ultimatum

choices: Return to Weiss and Co.'s perspective
1123311222212222131211111123321111122131.content:
Two tense minutes passed in complete silence as Weiss waited for her sister's answer.
“……Fine. I'll see what I can do. But I make no promises. “

Weiss felt a sense of cautious relief pass through her at the woman's words.
“ Thank you……winter. “ Weiss said quietly.
After that exchange, the younger Schnee sibling hanged up her scroll leaving the eldest to ponder on how to go about making this happen.

Her scroll once again rang out, no doubt her superiors wanting to check in on her progress.

She placed the device in some slot on her desk and watched as a cone of bluish light shone down from
the ceiling with a series of computer monitor-like screens materializing into being shortly after.
On each of the screens were the forms of various individuals in very nice clothes. One of the individuals
Displayed on the screens was the familiar form of general ironwood.
“ specialist schnee. What are these reports I'm seeing about a Gigant girl suddenly appearing into existence where the tear used to be?” the cybernetic man inquired his subordinate.
“ They're all true sir.” Winter said without skipping a beat.

“Including the ones that say that the Gigant in question was your sister?

The army woman swallowed a lump in her throat.
“Yes sir…” she said quieter this time.
Ironwood seemed put off by this
“ From what you've told me and according to all of our background checks, she was a normal sized human until this evening. How is this possible?”
Winter tensed up slightly, not looking forward to the conversation that was about to transpire.
“ It would seem that interacting with the anomaly has caused her to under go some kind of metamorphosis. As to why this is the case your guess is as good as mine.”
One of the forms projected on the screen, an elderly man and an well respected atlasian scientist, expressed great interest in this revelation .
“Fascinating.” The scientist said with intrigue in his voice.

“We need to bring this young woman here. Weiss was it? If we could somehow ascertain the true nature of her transformation and its relation to the tears we could usur in a new age of scientific advancement and progress!”
Winter spoke up.
“ About that. Is it possible to refrain from experimenting on my sister at this point in and time?”
Iron wood raised his eyebrow at this.
“Whatever for?” the cybernetic man asked.
Winter steeled herself for what may happen next.
“ I think something may have happened to my sister that has made her squeamish about being experimented on and so I ask that that you not try to bring her in, at least until I can convince her to see the wisdom of what we're trying to do.”
The scientist seemed to bristle at this.

“ I apologize Ms. Shnee but I don't see how the emotional outbursts of a teenage girl should impede from pursuing enlightenment.” The elderly man said with annoyance in his voice.

Winter did not skip a beat.
“ With all due respect, other than being my sister and a human being, she is also a very large and powerful Gigant who is currently in a very emotional state and most likely won't come quietly. If we try to force this she will retaliate. And considering the apparently apocalyptic events that have transpired over in vale due to a handful of Gigant girls sparring, that would be a horrible idea.”
Winter said emphasizing that last part.

The scientist was about to retort before the general spoke up.
“ She makes a good point. Very well , we'll refrain from trying to bring her in with force but we still need to know what's going on. What do you suggest we do?” Iron wood said seeing the wisdom in the military woman's words, the scientist pouted at that.

The smallest hint of a smile had adorned the woman's face.

“ I propose that instead of experimenting on her directly, we bring her and several individuals of her choice to a self contained location where they will be instructed to perform a series of tasks that will be scanned and measured using third party systems and instruments.”
Ironwood pondered on the merits of her suggestion but was still troubled by one thing.

“I can see where you're going with this, but how are we supposed to get any substantial data if we can't test her body directly?”
Winter felt that was a fair question but fortunately she had already come up with a solution.

“ I thought that that we could use ‘that' project” winter said cryptically.

Ironwood took on a more serious tone.
“I'm not sure if that is a wise idea. Do you think It can even get us what we want?” the general said warily.
The military woman remained resolute in her decision.
“It's the only other means we have that isn't invasive.”
The general was still unconvinced.
“You are aware of the potential consequences right?” the decorated man said trying to urge caution.
Winter paused for a moment but she had already made up her mind.
“ Yes I am sir.”

A few moments of tense silence had passed before ironwood finally spoke.
“ Very well, I will have the project greenlit.”

Winter breathed a sigh of relief.
“thank you sir.”
Ironwood smiled at his subordinate.
“Your welcome. Now let's proceed with the rest of today's agenda.”
As everyone prepared their materials, winter looked out at the window in her office.

“you owe me one sister.”

11233112222122221312111121.content:
A fair distance away from where Ruby and her friends had begun their workout, a group of Hunters and Huntresses in training headed for the forest. There were apparently some Grimm sightings that needed to be dealt with, and the team, looking for both school credit and practical experience, volunteered to go deal with the situation. Their leader, a scraggly teen with bushy brown hair, seemed annoyed at the confusion that the staff had when they volunteered.

“Hunters and Huntresses have been dealing with Grimm for generations! Just because some bloated freaks are walking around campus we’re supposed to be in the background?”

“You mean like that blonde haired idiot we had to work with last week?” his friend, a black haired man with a thick build asked.

“He was the worst! Thinking that we couldn’t do anything without the help of him and the big redhead! I don’t care if they don’t want us sparring Gigants, I’m going to knock that big blonde dumbass off his feet and show the teachers that Gig...”

The train of thought he had was interrupted by earthquakes, but not the normal, quick shocks from the movement of Gigants, but forceful, shaking bursts of seismic activity so powerful that none of the group could stand on their feet.

“What’s going on?” a black haired girl asked, only for her to gasp as the very ground beneath them began to crack. Struggling mightily to their feet, the group ran as far away from the forming chasms as they could, desperately trying to figure out what was going on.

“We’ve got to get to town!” The girl said. “The buildings there are all built for...”

“LOOK!”

Off in the distance, one of the mountains that overlooked the forest and Beacon academy literally exploded into dust, as if someone had set up countless tons of explosives on it. The shock of seeing an indomitable part of nature just vanish into dust terrified the the group as they desperately sought shelter from the disasters occurring in front of them. Their legs travelled as quickly as they could as the group looked up and saw a pitch black sky, with bolts of lightning and flashes of light shining deep in the forest.

“That’s Grimm territory!” the brown haired man said. “But Grimm couldn’t be doing that, right?”

“Not unless Grimm suddenly got huge boobs! Look!”

The brief flashes of light revealed the towering figures battling for brief moments, Gigant girls whose muscles and height tore the ground asunder and created loud booms of power and sound that knocked away trees and animals like they didn’t exist.

There was nowhere to run, nowhere to hide from the force of nature that was these girls. For a brief moment, the brown haired teen saw the folly of thinking he could oppose these...demigods in any way. He should have been glad that team JNPR’s Gigants were friendly, because the force here was proof that if they wanted to take over the world, no force of little people could ever hope to stop them. Looking up, hoping it would all go away, he realized that his team would likely not survive this.

A cone of light and heat surged through the atmosphere into the stars as its impact headed right for the group. Everyone screamed but it was drowned out by the force of the energy headed for them.

and super sized Grimm and is ruled over by tribes of giant Amazons and Gargareans ( Male equivalent to Amazons) of both human and faunus origins possessing of immense physical and spiritual power.

1123311222222.title: Ruby of the jungle!

11233112222221.content:
Ruby focused her semblance with a sense of purpose driving her actions, she already knew what she was doing first.

For as long as she could remember, the young huntress had been a fan of sword and sorcery comics.
Specifically ones set in harsh and savage worlds, like her Nacnon and scarlet Janos books, where the land is covered by vast forests and jungles and strange, deadly, and fantastical creatures of all shapes and sizes lurked around every corner and every day the inhabitants were locked in epic battles for survival in a wild and unforgiving land.

There was danger in these worlds, yes, but there was also freedom.
Freedom from social norms.
Freedom from the rules established by society.
Freedom from the drudgery of everyday life.
Freedom to be your true self.
And most importantly, freedom from any personal hang ups.

The people in those stories knew what they wanted and didn't waste any time going after it.
They slept when they were tired, ate when they were hungry, fucked when they were horny, and fought and played when ever they felt like!

Yes. That was what Ruby wanted, craved even.

As she was about make this fantasy of hers a reality, she paused.

There was a few other fantasies she wanted to experience as well.

Ruby would always have fantasies about Amazons and their lesser known counterparts the Gargareans.
Women and men who were larger and stronger than their more pedestrian peers who lived in tribalistic warrior societies and lived very martial life styles.
They would fight against their foes alongside their brothers and sisters and conquer distant lands, living by the code of the sword and the law of the jungle.
She found the whole idea quite romantic.
There was one other idea that the crimsonette wanted to play with.
This one was very personal to her and made her blush at the thought of going through with it.
You see she had a thing for giants.
She liked big things in general but she especially had a thing for gints.
There was something about the sheer difference in scale between a giant and a normal sized person that did something for her.
She could remember the first time she discovered her attraction to such things.
She was still five years old at the time and her dad had read her a bedtime story about a boy climbing up a giant bean stalk in order to get inside a giant’s castle.
She found the whole idea of giants so interesting that she wanted to find more stories and material on the subject and had always looked for them online when ever she had some free time, sometimes she would even have day dreams about being a giant herself.
It was just about when she hit puberty that this took on a more sexual nature.
On one night when she would get on the computer in her father's study when everyone was asleep, and looked up her preferred subject. As she scrolled through the list of various hits , a link that read “18+” and
“Mature” on it's title. Curious, she clicked on it.
What she found was a vast library of giants and little people engaged in all kinds of suggestive activities.
Needless to say, this experience spawned many a wet dream for the young woman.
Ruby smiled at the fond memory.
She decided that she would combine the three fantasies together.

Once more, Ruby focused on her semblance and etched her will upon the fabric of reality.

11233112222221.title: Call of the wild

112331122222211.content:
The sun hung in a burning orange sky radiating it's searing heat upon a vast seemingly unending jungle landscape.
Somewhere on the Jungle floor, a group of people could be seen running as fast as their legs could carry them, desperate to escape the terrifying force that pursued them.
The tree line shook violently and many flocks of birds scattered into the sky as loud booming sounds rumbled through the earth at regular intervals.
The people continued to run away, their lungs burning and their feet aching ,their very bones screamed from fatigue, but they couldn't stop, stopping would mean certain death.
A Blood curdling squeal tore out from the tree line, causing the runners to pick up the pace.
Eventually, the runners found themselves confronted with the face of a cliff wall.
The group’s blood collectively ran cold.

They had reached a dead end.

The Booming sounds had grown deafeningly loud now, whatever was chasing them had caught up.
The group turned towards the tree line to face their encroaching doom.
The rumbling grew louder and animalistic grunts could now be heard alongside them.

Suddenly, a massive explosion of dirt, stones and vegetation erupted in front of the group, ripping whole trees out from there roots and into the air and flung the group hard into the cliff face.
The hapless souls coughed and choked on the dust as they struggled to their feet, the sense of dread they felt was almost palpable.
When the dust finally settled, the true form of the group’s pursuer was revealed.
A great beast resembling some bizarre mutant hybrid between a Massive boar and a warthog stood menacingly in front the unfortunate group.
The creature towered over the very trees themselves!
It had a brownish grey Hide, six great tusks of various sizes protruding from its massive snout like curved lances, a wicked mane of maroon fur that grew on top of its head and all the way down its back to the base of it's long brush like tail, and stood upon two cloven hooves.
The creature stared down at the group with it's piercing rage filled gaze, its eyes like burning coals.
Suddenly, the Beast released a mighty roar that shook the jungle, the sky, and the very earth to their core!
The group of forsaken individuals could only cower and pray.
The great hog then crouched low and dragged its left hoof across the ground, indicating that it was about to attack.

It seemed like it was the end of the road for the group.

But then, just as the beast made to charge at its victims, it was struck by a massive object moving at ludicrous speeds and sent skidding across the ground for a couple of kilometers, knocking trees and boulders into the air and creating a fairly large trench in the process.

The group had braced themselves for death but when it didn't come they were confused, what could've possibly been powerful enough to do that to such a monster?

At that moment, the group felt another earthquake tear through the Jungle, this one even more powerful than the ones generated by the beast!

Panic and confusion gripped the hapless souls as the quakes grew louder and more frequent.
What in the name of the spirits was happening?

The group stopped in their tracks when the quaking stopped and they saw that a great shadow had been cast upon them.
They went to see what had made the shadow and became paralyzed with shock when they found it.
A titanic humanoid form stood before them.
It towered over everything around it including the great beast!

This could only mean one thing.

They were in the presence of a Giant! And an Amazon at that, if it's ridiculously massive curves were anything to go by.

her tan skin was covered in a vast assortment of intricately designed tribal marking that told many stories about the Amazon's conquest.
The giantess was possessed of truly massive yet muscles that contained unfathomable power within each one of its fibers that no normal human could even dream of approaching, her massive arms appearing able to crack the very planet in half.
She sported a pair of hips that stretched passed its hulking shoulders and an equally wide ass that if the being was a normal sized person would stick out behind by Five feet and stood upon a thick pair of legs that surpassed the very trees around them!

Further up past her relatively thin waist and mighty eight pack abs, the Amazon carried a pair of breasts thrice or even four times the size of her head that were held aloft by her mighty pectorals, they were so huge that none of the smaller humans were able see past them.

It was only when the Amazon bent over slightly that the group was able to make out her face.
The Giant appeared to be a young woman with silver eyes and black and red hair.
The group also noted that she was wearing a set of animal skin undergarments along with a grass skirt and had a bikini made from the ribs of some massive unknown creature that she had for a top as well as a plethora of ivory jewelry on different parts of her body.

So many questions were on the group's minds such who was this girl and what tribe she hailed from.

Whether the Amazon's arrival was a blessing or an omen remained to be seen.




--------000--------
112331122222211.title: Call of the wild Continued

1123311222222111.content:
Ruby had been spending the better part of the morning hunting for prey, but she was having a bit of trouble in that regard.
That was until she heard the fearful cries of a group of tinies followed by the angry squeals of a what sounded like a Tor'busha, a great hog of the jungle.

“A Tor'busha would be perfect for breakfast!” Ruby thought to herself, donning a grin.

The Amazon then proceeded to shadow the beast and the unfortunate souls it sought to devour, concealing her presence using a spirit or “Roh" art, a form of magic that can be harnessed by any creature bearing a soul that has had its aura awakened, usually after it has acquired its semblance.
A good half hour had passed when the great hog finally stopped in front of a large cliff wall, most likely having cornered it's quarry.

Unbeknownst to it however, it was the one who was cornered.

Ruby hefted a large rock/boulder and tested its weight.
Satisfied, she drew her arm back and took aim.
Just as it was about to charge, Ruby swung arm and chucked her stone at the tor'busha with tremendous force.
The missile screamed through the air at super sonic speeds before landing a clean hit on its targets head,
Launching it forwards where it skidded across the ground a good distance .

Ruby internally cheered at her successful hit and released her cloak to confront her downed prey.
The young Amazon knew that it would've been significantly easier and more efficient to simply remain concealed but she wanted this hunt to at least be somewhat interesting.

As she approached the fallen Tor'busha she saw it begin to stir and pick itself up.

It was a tough little bastard she'd give it that.

Blood ran down the hog's face as it stared down the interloper before it, Rage burning in its eyes.
Ruby simply stood there with her hands on her hips and a smug smirk on her face.
The scarlet Titaness then winked at the beast, inciting its fury.

With a mighty earth shaking squeal, the beast charged the Amazon at full force, huge trees and boulders were sent flying through the air in its wake but the scarlet Amazon simply stood there undaunted.
The hog collided with the Amazon with a deafening crash, a massive explosion erupted from the point of impact that threw massive clouds of dust and debris into the air and caused a substantial earthquake to shake the entire jungle to its foundations.
A few minutes passed when the dust finally settled enough to make out what had happened.
Where once there was lush vegetation there was now a massive crater and a trench that extended fifty meters into the ground.
At the bottom of the crater, two massive forms could be made out.
The giant girl was still standing, completely unfazed by the attack while the Tor'busha lied on the ground dazed and in pain!
Ruby let out an earth shaking chuckle.
She found the Beast’s assault assuming but it was time to end this hunt.
Ruby drew her right arm back and delivered a devastating blow to the great hogs head.
A massive pillar of dust and debris shot up high into the sky as a massive explosion far larger than the one the hog had produced rang out through the jungle for miles, creating a massive spider web of fissures spread throughout the surrounding landscape and producing powerful gale force winds that blew away everything from the point of impact.
When the dust eventually settled, the Amazon could be seen at the bottom of an even larger two hundred meter deep crater standing triumphantly over the Tor'busha,whose skull had clearly been caved in.

After draping her prize over her shoulder, the Amazon leapt out of the crater two hundred meters into the air and landing directly in front of the cliff wall where the group of normal sized people had retreated to.

Ruby looked down at the group from her towering vantage point.
Those of the group who weren't knocked unconscious form the explosions and gale force winds were either dazed or staring up at her with fear and uncertainty in their eyes.

Ruby felt pity for the small people, the world could be a truly harsh and unforgiving place for ones such as them.
The world of remnant was a primeval and savage realm where only the hardiest and most determined of beings even stood a chance at seeing another day.
Where titanic beasts, eldritch abominations, half mad necromantic sorcerer's, feral deities, and forces even greater still roamed the land wild and untamed.
Where the only true laws that governed this land were the laws of steel, club, and fang and survival of the fittest.
Among the titans that ruled this world were the Giant tribes, a race of Amazonian and Gargarean warriors possessed of truly monolithic stature and unthinkably potent physical and spiritual power that waged unending wars of dominance and glory against each other and anything that they deemed a threat or a worthy challenge or conquest.
The Giant tribes spent most of their lives either fighting, hunting, playing, or pursuing any path they chose.
Meanwhile, the normal sized Humans which the Giants had dubbed “Nogo” were forced to eek out a meager existence near the bottom of the food chain, constantly having to fend off predators and invaders while hiding their settlements from Giant beasts and Giant tribesmen that might either eat or capture them for various purposes respectively.
As Ruby looked down at the Nogo cowering at her feet, she pondered on what to do next….

choices: Ruby gives the nogo a tour of the village first
112331122222211122212.content:
With her enhanced senses, Ruby could see the haggard appearance of the Nogo at her feet.
From the looks of it they all belonged to the same tribe based on the identical style of markings on their bodies.
The poor things must've had their entire village destroyed by the Tor'busha she had killed. They wouldn't have anywhere to go.
It was a pitiable sight.
Ruby pondered on what to do to help these people .
Her face lite up when an idea came to her. She could take them back to her village and they could join them as tribe members!
The Nogo would probably be grateful to have protection from a tribe of giants. Ruby mused to herself.
The Amazon crouched down before the cowering group of Nogo and lifted her unoccupied hand which then began to glow a bright red.
Moments later, the tiny people found themselves lifted bodily into the air by some unseen force and drawn towards the Amazon who scooped them out of the air and in her massive hand.
Ruby stood back up to her full mind bending height of 500 feet tall and brought the group of Nogo to her face.
“ they're so cute!” Ruby squee’d internally.
She gave them a warm smile.
“Your all going to love being members of the dragon rose tribe!” Ruby boomed, unintentionally causing the group of Nogos ear's to ring from the volume.
The crimson Amazon then proceeded to deposit the Tiny people into the valley of her immense clevage.
Once she was sure they were secure, she turned around and began her return trip to the village, her mouth already watering at the thought of all the meals that were going to be prepared.

As the young Amazon makes her journey back home , we take a look at her unwilling passengers.
Most of them were filled with anxiety and apprehension , with the destruction of their home and now being kept in the clutches of a giant, their future was looking very uncertain.
Two of them in particular were really feeling the mood.

One of them, a young woman named Kulita, was scanning around their fleshy surroundings desperately searching for a way out of their predicament.
Meanwhile, the the second person, a young man named Tempkii, was curled up into a ball with a look of resignation in his face and body language.
Kulita grunted angrily out of frustration.
“ Damn it! This is insane!” Kulita shouted, throwing her hands up into the air.
She turned to her somber friend.
“Hey, Tempkii. Help me find a way off this Giant bimbo!”
The ashen haired man remained silent .
Kulita got up close to his face.
“ Hey! Tempkii! I'm talking to you!”
Still he remained silent.
Kulita started to grow concerned.
“Tempkii?”
“…….It doesn’t matter…..” The sullen man said under his breath.
“I'm sorry. could you repeat that?” Kulita asked, having not caught what the quite man said.
“I said it doesn't matter.” Tempkii said louder this time.

Drapped on its surface were massive tarps that bore what could only be the tribes embroidery, a stylized serpentine winged dragon whose body is wrapped around a rose.
Ruby made her way to the immense protective wall that surrounded what the Nogo suspected was the Amazon's village, and came upon a massive and very intimidating looking entrance that towered over the scarlet giant.
Two wooden gates with an archway covered in wooden stakes and a plethora of bones and skulls, both animal and humanoid alike, were built all over their surfaces.
It was a rather gruesome sight and did nothing to engender confidence in the Amazon's Nogo passengers.

On either side of the entrance were two giant scaled watch towers made out of carved stone and wood that were covered with vines and leaves for climbing.
Standing at the top of said watch towers were two Gargareans that stood as sentinels keeping watch, their eyes constantly scanning the area for any would be Invader and/or Great beast that ventured too close.
Ruby waved at the guards as she made her way to the gates with a big smile on her face.
One of the guards perked up when he saw her approach and waved back at her.
“Hey Ruby! I see your hunt has born fruit. Tell me, did the beasts give you any trouble?” the guard asked, eager to hear any stories of triumph the scarlet Amazon may possess.
Ruby slammed her fist upon her chest.
