The guard simply chuckled at her response.
“ Oh I bet.”
The guard move forward from where he stood in order to get a better look at the Amazon.

“Oh! I almost forgot! I also found a group of Nogo on my hunt as well. They were running away from the Tor'busha I slayed. It must have destroyed their village so I thought that maybe we could bring them into the fold. Ruby said pointing towards her cleavage.

Ruby nodded her head.
“Don't worry I will!” Ruby promised.
The guard signaled to the others to open the gate.
Two Gargareans pulled on a set of ropes with their Herculean strength and dragged the great entrance open.
A loud rumbling sound was emitted by the gates as many tons of stone and soil were pushed aside.
As Ruby made her way through the gate , she turned towards the guards one more time.
"See you guys at breakfast!
The guards waved at her one more time before closing the gates.
Ruby stared ahead at the village and wondered what to do first…….

Pleased would be the perfect word to currently describe one, Weiss Schnee. After nearly four whole months of painstakingly hard work and research, she'd finally completed her latest dust mixture for professor Peach's next class.

An orange dust mixture that in theory could help expand one's own aura.

Surprisingly enough she got the idea from Nora of all people in class when she'd accidently overheard the hyperactive redhead talking to Jaune about his absurd reserves.

It was a great idea too. Genius actually. There were plenty of huntsman and huntress out in the world of Remnant that had very little to no aura at all. One good swipe from a Grimm and they'd be done for.

But with her latest concoction that limitation would be a thing of the past. Anyone with a weak aura would be able to bolster their own and be able to fight longer and heal faster.

The possibilities for her 'Infinity Dust' as she was calling it, were potentially limitless.

Oh she could see it now, her success reaching the far ends of Remnant and beyond. The best part being the knowledge she succeeded on her own without her father's influence.

The thought brought a smile to her face reserved only for her butler back home. Only Klein was allowed to see her smile like this.

The only thing to do now was...

"WEISS!"

The loud shouting of her name fallowed by her team leaders sudden appearance caused the snow-haired girl to yelp in surprise. Which in tern caused her to throw her latest project high in the sky.

"NO!" Weiss shouted as she tried to catch the vile... only for it to fall and shatter before her very eyes. Just like that all her hard work floated away through the air vent.

"Oops." Ruby chuckled nervously. "Was that important."

The near murderous look Weiss turned towards her was more than enough to answer her question.

"I-I'll just... uh." Ruby jetted away.

Weiss shook her head in annoyance. "That girl."

All that remained of her hard work and potential A+ was shattered vile of nothing.

"That's just perfect." she grumbled as she began to carefully pick up the shards. "How am I going to explain this to professor Peach?"

Unbeknownst to her, her dust didn't completely fade away, she had inhaled enough of it.

"C'mon, Ice Queen! They're about to open!"

"Are you sure about this, Yang?" Weiss blinked up at the large, imposing Vale Gymnasium with more than a hint of skepticism in her eyes. "It's rather early for a workout."

"Oh come on, Weiss!" Yang said, tugging on her teammate's arm impatiently. "I wanna be first on the treadmills. And it's not early at all. Everyone here's waiting for them to open!"

Weiss eyed the assembly of large, sweaty, musclebound guys with an equal mixture of apprehension and interest. Apprehension because—well, they were sweaty, and more often than not far too hairy. But she had to admit that the bulging biceps and chest she noted on one particular sunny golden dragon were quite appealing.

"Ugh, very well," she huffed. "But I don't want to try anything too rough, though. I ."

Yang scoffed. "Oh please. You gotta get rough at the gym, Weiss. Or at least work hard at it." She grinned and began teasing Weiss by flexing her right arm, her left hand squeezing her massive bicep. "How else are you gonna get buff like me?"

"I-I don't want to get 'buff' or anything!" Weiss snapped while heavily blushing at Yang's tease. "I-I just want to be a little more in-shape, is all."

"Fine, whatever, Ice Queen." Yang rolled her eyes, slightly annoyed at Weiss' complaining. "But you still have to take this at least a little bit seriously. I mean seriously, who spends two hours straightening their hair before going to the gym?"

"Excuse me?! A heiress who takes pride in her appearance is someone who spends two hours straightening their hair before going to the gym, you dolt!" Weiss snapped, clearly offended by Yang's remark. "And I'll not have you forget it, Xiao Long!. I refuse to get it all sweaty and messy and dirty, unlike some of these...m-muscleheads!!"

"Sure, sure." Yang waved a hand noncommittally, not at all fazed by Weiss' outburst. "Now c'mon! It's seven—they're opening the doors!"

Sure enough, they were. The heiress only offered a token protest this time as Yang dragged her to the front of the line and then Team WY found themselves entering right through the double glass doors. Once inside, Weiss took a deep breath, and was disgusted caught a whiff of plastic and cheap air freshener. Then again, it was better than the horrid stench of musk and sweat she'd been expecting. An artificial atmosphere was simply marvelous compared to that swill.

She reluctantly followed Yang down to the lockers, where the two huntresses stowed their clothes and bags away in a shared locker. Weiss accepted a hand-towel with a skeptical look—she doubted that she'd need it, and vowed to leave immediately for a shower if she did—but didn't otherwise comment. After that, she followed Yang up the stairs to the main area of the gym.

"I'll be over there at the treadmills." Yang jabbed a finger toward a long line of large black machines, where one or two gym-goers were already jogging along at a moderate pace. "You should probably start over there as well to get your heart rate going, but you can try out any of the machines first, just to give it a try."

"Hm." Weiss scanned the line of exercise machines around her with a questioning eye. "What's that one over there?" she asked, pointing in the direction of a flat, black-leather bench with a barbell positioned above it.

"That's the bench pressing area," Yang said with a grin on her face. "Good for tightening up your arms and burning fat around your glutes." Yang then slapped her tight butt with an open palm, then grinned when a light blush rose beneath Weiss's cheeks. "Should be just what you're looking for, really. Not much of a bulk-up machine...unless you wanna have thicker arms."

"Tightening," Weiss mused. "Hm. Maybe having stronger arms COULD be useful for battling Grimm." Weiss then had a blush on her face. "Yes; I think I'll try that."

"Cool. I knew you'd come around" Yang took a gulp of water from her bottle, then screwed the top back on and jabbed a thumb toward the treadmills. "Like I said, you know where to find me. And the machine should have directions on it, but if you need any help with form, feel free to ask."

"Thank you," Weiss said smugly. "But I believe I'll manage quite well on my own. It's just a silly little machine, after all. I mean, these muscleheads manage to use it regularly, and they don't seem to have any problem with it. Even YOU can use it with ease, Yang. The weights clanked with movement as the Y of Team RWBY lifted the bar up and down. The blonde bombshell huffed as a thin trail of sweat rolled down her forehead, her muscles coiled with the exertion, tensing as she the bar was lifted until reaching her neck, only to be lowered down once again.

Aura made muscle mass meaningless with its ability to strengthen the body's endurance and power, but its capacity to do so was proportional to the user's own physical fitness. IE; Someone with stronger muscles could increase their strength through Aura with greater efficency than someone with a less fit body.

To sum it up; If she made her muscles bigger then she would kick and even greater ammount of ass.

Yang couldn't help but grin mid rep, imagening biceps worthy of her fighting style, and maybe her overall body being much more muscular too. Why not? She already had a pretty nice abdominal definition, might as well go for the whole set. After all, she didn't think muscles on a lady weren't unattractive, in fact, watching those motivational posters with those fitness girls sporting those big muscles was kinda sexy. There was an allure to having that strength

Good thing Beacon had top of the line training equipment; Weights enhanced with gravity dust that could increase their weight on a vocal command, endurance machines which could adapt to the user's progress, that sort of thing

Finishing the rep, Yang set the bar back on its rack and let out a long breath. Her yellow workout t-shirt, with the words 'I Burn' written with big black letters, clung tightly to her sweating form, her black workout shorts hugged her nicely defined glutes, showing off her long shapely legs. She walked foward to one of the big mirrors on the wall, her long yellow hair helf up in a high ponytail swaying behind her as she walked, and took a good look at herself.

Placing her left hand on her hip and lifting her right arm, Yang flexed her bicep and watched as a small mound rose beneath the sleeve, the definition noticeable and the size showing a good gain.

Yang for her part...

Coco starts to grow slowly in front of Velvet, tearing up her outfit
Coco explodes in front of Velvet, becoming a massive, naked giantess
1512.content:
The forest of Forever Fall was a sea of vibrant red, overlaid against the sunset sky to produce a warm sight. Normally serene as a landscape painting, a small section of the forest shook & rattled across the vista, leaves flying, trees falling, ruining the serene, static image.

"RATATATATATATAT" In the center of the forest's action, the barrel of Gianduja rotated, expelling high-velocity Dust bullets that exploded on impact against the trunks of the forest trees, causing them to fall to pieces, a black phantom darting from each wooden corpse as it fell to tatters. Coco rotated in place at a steady pace, matching the Geist as it tried to flee, firing into whatever it tried to possess until it was left with no options to run. Tree by tree burst at the combination of Coco's Semblance & her bullets, sending a haze of wooden dust & dirt particles everywhere, creating a coffee-colored fog of war befitting of her team name; the Geist would eventually have nowhere to go, and her gun would impact against its bony mask, sending the Grimm to the great beyond - mission complete.

"We're done with the stragglers. Have you finished the Geist yet, Coco?" The thoughts of her teammate, Fox, rang in Coco's mind - a telepathy channel used to keep the team together, even when separated, constantly updating one another on their Grimm quarry.

"Not yet," she replied, "Little sucker's really moving around fast. Start coming towards the cloud of dust, guys, one of you might be able to get it on its next round." The Geist kept making circles around Coco, trying to move from tree to tree for some form of a body to strike back, but the fashionista wasn't having it, she put all of her Hype into each & every round to turn the mighty oaks to mere woodchips upon immediate impact - she was almost toying with it in a sense. "Ah, ah, ah," she mocked, "Those suits are far out of your value, stud." Coco was having fun messing with the Geist on some level, taking joy in blowing up the wilderness, but it had to come to an end at some point, else her professors would be mad at her for defacing one of Remnant's most beautiful forests.

The Geist couldn't agree more, this had to end. It changed its trajectory, coming in closer towards Coco, risking the bullet hailstorm - it darted towards a couple mid-sized rocks, ones that could do some damage if possessed, but failed to dash quickly enough as it exploded into a gray mist of particles. The Geist wasn't deterred, it dashed towards more stones, closer and closer to Coco, which she quickly destroyed with her gun. The visibility was getting poor at this point, Coco could barely see through the haze as is with her sunglasses, it didn't help the cloud was getting larger & closer to her the more she fired. "What's it doing? Is it trying to make a tornado or something to possess? I can't see with this- wait a second..." Coco slowed her firing rate for a moment, taking a moment to think - a wry smile formed on her lips as she figured out the Geist's gambit. She slowly released her finger from the trigger and begun to back up, letting her gun change back to its basic purse form, feigning huffing in a panic - if her intuition was right, the Geist would be coming for her any moment now. As if on cue, a bright yellow light came from behind Coco's field of view - the Geist charged at her with its claws, ready to slice her in two...

The Geist felt the weight of Gianduja's purse format press directly into its mask, cracking it in multiple places. The phantasm shrieked in pain and fumbled against the dirt floor, its body dissipating into a black mist. Coco swung her purse over her shoulder and chuckled - those meditation & sensory exercises Yatsuhashi & Fox taught her really paid off. Coco backed up towards where the Geist disappeared, her upper body feeling sore from all the twisting & arm-movement to chase the Geist; she moved her back against a soft, tall forest mushroom, one strange oddity of nature in Forever Fall, and leaned back into it, letting the coziness soothe her muscles. "The Geist is down." Coco shot out through Fox's channel. "Mission complete." Coco sunk to the ground and sat down, she was really going to need a hot bath & nap when she got back to Beacon; CFVY's team leader was quite thankful for the therapeutic shifting the mushroom was doing on her back, almost like a massage chair...

"Wait, why's this moving so much?" Coco tilted her head upwards, and from behind the hem of her shades, she came eye-to-eye with a few surviving sections of the Geist's mask, eye glowing gold in rage. Coco tried to dart upwards, but in an act of revenge, the Geist shook, spraying an orange pollen around its new body, making a new cloud of particles where the old one just began to disperse. Coco coughed in a panic, swinging Gianduja around as she backed up - her eyes teared up and she couldn't see through the stinging sensation, the Geist could've been primed to attack for all she knew. Indeed, it was - a root of the mushroom tore from the ground, and was primed to strike Coco across the face...

"Coco!" a female voice with a heavy accent cried from above. The Geist tried to turn and react, but was powerless as a brown-haired girl with rabbit ears fell from the sky, splitting the mushroom & mask in half with a translucent scythe. The Geist let out one final, pathetic cry as the bunny-girl swung the scythe around, spinning on her toes in a kneeling position - the Grimm's black mist & orange pollen dissipated, and as the sky cleared, so did the girl's weapon, disappearing into shining particles of Dust. The girl, the rabbit Faunus Velvet, leapt to her feet and ran towards her team leader, wrapping her arms around the beret-wearing girl for support. "Coco! Are you okay?! What was that orange stuff it shot?"

"I'm fine, V." Coco coughed out, "It was just mushroom spores, it stings a bit, but it's nothing that the medical room at Beacon can't deal with." As Coco spoke, she continued to cough and clear her throat mid-sentence, rubbing her eyes with her free hand to clear the tears. Coco was putting on a brave front, but Velvet was still concerned for her leader - she looked at the remains of the mushroom the Geist once possessed.

"I dunno," she replied, "I've never seen a mushroom that large before, let alone that shape or color. It might be poisonous for all we know..."

"I'm fine, Velvet, really." Coco tried to stand up straight, but found herself fidgeting a little bit, rubbing her hands across her upper body, a chilly sensation pulsing through her muscles. Despite the internal struggle, Coco continued to proclaim she was fine, standing erect and fixing her sunglasses on her face. "Let's just get in contact with Fox & Yatsu, I want to get home before whatever that was sets into my clothes..." Velvet looked down her team leader one more time, feeling a little concerned as she watched Coco keep rubbing her hands against her shoulders, like something was a matter with her.

"Fox? Yatsu? It's Velvet, I've retrieved Coco. The Geist is dead, and all other Grimm should be exterminated here for now."

"Is Coco alright?" Fox's voice rang back.

"She says she is, but she was exposed to these spores from a strange mushroom the Geist possessed. We need to get her back to Beacon immediately."

"Got it. Head north to the forest clearing, we'll rendezvous there while Yatsu & I hail a helicopter."

"Roger." With the communication line ceased, Velvet got under Coco's left arm and wrapped it around her neck, carrying Coco against her back as the fashionable young woman shuddered. "Come on now, Coco, let's get you back in bed."

"T-Thanks, V. But slow down a bit, I have a headache, and- ack!"

"Ack?"

"It's my boots, something's up with them. Damn, I thought these things would've at least lasted me until the end of my time here. I'll have to go get a new pair made..." Coco shivered as if she was chilly, or her body was fighting off some sort of infection, but to the leader of Team CFVY, Coco was blissfully unaware of the reaction the frenzied spores were having on her body...

choices: Velvet makes Cardin worship her feet? (Revenge is sweet)
15221.content:
Velvet was so sick of Cardin Winchester. He was nothing more than a bully and an oppressor. She just so happen to have the misfortune of being his favorite target. Well... Maybe not his favorite, he did seem to enjoy giving that Jaune boy a hard time. But that was beside the point, he was just an all around jerk that got off on making everyone else miserable.

The reason he had singled her out however, was due to her status as a faunus. Because she was born with rabbit ears on her head, he had taken it upon himself to be as much of an ass as possible. She'd done nothing to him, she'd never even exchanged a simple greeting with him. Yet he still felt the need to remind her that he was someone she should watch out for.

It wasn't right.

Velvet wasn't a mean girl, in fact most people who knew her well enough could tell she didn't have a single mean bone in her body. Even when her teammates had offered to rough up the ignorant boy, she talked them down. Her leader Coco wasn't happy, but in the end she and the rest of team CVFY could only respect Velvet's decision.

But, even the kindest of people can only be pushed so far. Cardin had taken her kindness for weakness, a mistake most people are taught not to make. Because Velvet didn't fight back, the leader of team CRDL thought he could do whatever he pleased to her without any repercussions.

Wrong!

Unknown to him, he had finally managed to due the near impossible. Make. Velvet. Angry! He had managed to achieve this great feat during lunch when he had committed the greatest sin against her. He'd upgraded from simple taunts and name calling to physical assault. Cardin Winchester made the biggest mistake of his short life when he grabbed her ears.

Even when she begged him to stop, he only laughed in her face. He pulled and pulled until he managed to make her cry in front o the whole cafeteria. It didn't matter to him that he hurt and embarrassed her. It only served to make him feel superior.

That's when Velvet knew she finally had enough!

Cardin needed to be taught a lesson. The teachers clearly weren't going to give it to him! So it was all down to her to teach him a lesson he'd never forget. For the first time in her life, Velvet was going to entertain the idea of an eye for an eye. She was going to get even. She was going to make Cardin understand what it felt like to be small... Literally.

It took weeks of planning, but she finally had everything she needed to get her revenge. Unfortunately for the rest of team CFVY, they weren't invited to the party. That extended to the rest of team CRDL as well. It would be just her and her long time oppressor. Velvet lost track of how long she spent shadowing Cardin. Learning his patterns and mannerism. At this point she felt like she knew her bully better than her own teammates.

That didn't matter though, today was the day she'd brake Cardin Winchester. Everything was set up smoothly. First she'd lure Cardin away, deep into the Emerald Forest where no cameras would see them, and no scroll signal could reach the academy. Next she'd bust out her secret weapon. She did feel guilty about stealing it from the Schnee girl, but what she didn't know wouldn't hurt her. Then... The fun would begin. All Velvet had to do was wait.

After about an hour of waiting a familiar voice came calling through the Emerald Forest. "Hello!? Nikos!? You out here!? I got your text!"

Velvet couldn't help but giggle from behind her hiding spot. As if the 'invincible girl' would ever be interested in him.

Cardin heard the rustling of a nearby bush and smirked. "Hey babe! That you?"

It was showtime.

Instead of being greeted by the idol of Beacon Academy, he was greeted by the rabbit of Vale. "What are you doing here flopsy?" he asked in annoyance.

Velvet merely smiled. "Who? Me? I called you here. Did you really think you were coming here to see Pyrrha? You're not her type."

Cardin growled in anger, he'd been duped. He quickly regained his composure however and gave the brunette a cocky grin. "So you called me out here? All by yourself? No teammates? That wasn't very smart." Yes he came unarmed like the text said, but he didn't need a mace to put this animal in her place. "I guess I'm gonna have to teach you another lesson, flopsy."

Much to his surprise, the rabbit didn't look worried or scared at all. In fact she was unnervingly calm. Velvet simply shook her head and stared back at her school bully who had yet grasp the severity of his situation. "You know I'm a year ahead of you correct. That makes me your upperclassmen."

"Your point?"

"As an upperclassmen it's my duty to look out for underclassmen. So now I'm going to educate you. I'm going to learn you a lesson in respect." Velvet declared.

Cardin simply cracked his knuckles. "I've heard enough out of you. Now it's go time."

"I couldn't agree more." Velvet then pulled a vial of pitch black dust from behind her back. "Now I'll educate you." Velvet smashed the dust vial on the ground beneath her and Cardin could only look on in confusion as one of his favorite puppies to kick was engulfed by the dark mist. All he could hear was the sound of Velvets frantic coughs and soon broke out in hysterical laughter. He didn't need to do a damn thing. The stupid animal would defeat herself.

His laughter soon halted when another sound reached his ear. The sound if something tearing. It was then he noticed the coughing ceased and instead the tearing sound continued on. Just what was happening in that mist?

Cardin quickly wished he didn't know. Deep inside the mist Velvet had managed to stop coughing but it still felt as if her lungs were on fire. Honestly her whole body felt as if it was heating up. Then she felt a tingling sensation deep within her gut. The first thing she felt was the tightness of her school uniform on her body. She could feel the very fabric holding it together being strained to the limit as her body began to expand.

The fabric began to tear in all sorts of places and she could feel her shoes instantly give out as they were torn asunder. Her uniform tore completely now, leaving her as bare as the day she entered the world. Thankfully she thought to not wear any underwear in preparation for today. She could soon see over the black mist as everything around her seemed to move farther and farther away. She just kept climbing and climbing until the trees could barely reach her knees.

Cardin stood wide-eyed, mouth agape at the sight. That puny little rabbit faunus just underwent one hell of a growth spurt. When she finally did stop growing, Cardin for the first time in his life felt a sense of real fear around the rabbit faunus.

"Wow. I didn't think I'd get this big." Velvet said in awe of her new size. She could see over every tree and almost over the mountains. As she looked around marveling at the view, a small little 'bug' came into her field of vision. That bug was none other the whimpering form of Cardin Winchester who had fallen flat on his backside. That was when she remembered what she was here for. "So tell me!" her voice boomed. "How does it feel to be so small?"

Cardin couldn't answer, he was far to scared.

"Now then! Let the lesson begin."

152211.content:
"Now then! Let the lesson begin."

"No! No! No!" Cardin screamed. This whole situation was insane. One minute flopsy was miniscule and the next she'd grown into a giant. It was too much for his tiny mind to handle. His fight or flight instincts took over and flight seemed to win out. Cardin scrambled to his feet and began to run.

Beacon! All he had to do was make it back to school and he'd be home free. The teachers could deal with this monster. That was the plan. Too bad no plan survives first contact with the enemy. Cardin didn't get very far before a giant bare foot cut off his escape route. He slammed into it hard and was sent sprawling to the ground.

"Going somewhere?" Velvet asked with barely hidden amusement. She couldn't believe how easy it was to stop her bully dead in his tracks. She didn't really have to do anything except take a step forward. Seeing him fall back the way he did gave her a warm feeling in her chest. Was this how Cardin felt when he messed with her?

The downed leader of team CRDL quick shook off the cobwebs and got to hi feet again. He looked up a the giant foot which to him seemed as big as a bullhead. Fear tore through him as he tried to make a break for it yet again. Velvet saw this and cut off his escape for the second time.

For the second time that day, Cardin was sent crashing to the ground by giving Velvet's foot a face high five. Instead of getting right back up, Cardin propped himself up on his elbows and watched as the giant rabbit faunus giggled as his expense. A part of him felt angry, but the more rational part of his mind felt terrified.

Velvet saw her pray wasn't attempting to escape again and took this as her que to move things along. She knelt down to her 'bug' of a bully and asked him with hard eyes, "Are you going to try and escape again?"

It took everything he had not to piss his pants. "N-no!"

"Good!" Velvet smiled. "If you did I would've caught you, you know. You wouldn't want that because at your size you look mighty tasty."

Cardin blanched when he heard that. He didn't want to become some rabbit's dinner. "P-please don't eat me! I'm sorry, okay?! I am so, so sorry!"

"That's really sweet and mature of you to apologize, Cardin. It's just a shame I don't forgive you." Velvet answered. She really didn't either. He could apologize from now until she graduated from the academy and she still wouldn't accept his apology.

Cardin felt his heart sink. "Please just let me go."

"Did you let me go when you pulled my ears at the cafeteria or when I tried to walk away when you hurled slurs my way?" Velvet said with righteous anger boiling to the surface. "No you didn't! You treat others how you want to be treated and it's high time I taught you your actions have consequences!"

Velvet took a seat in front of Cardin. A simple action for her that caused a miniature earthquake for him. His eyes soon went wide when the giantess extended her foot towards him. Was she going to crush him flat?! The smaller boy began to whimper but stopped when he soon realized that wasn't the case.

"Ever since you arrived here in Beacon Academy you've gone out of your way to target me and make me feel lessor. Well it's my turn to feel superior and for you to feel lessor. You, Cardin Winchester, are going to massage my feet. Today you are not a huntsman in training or even a human being. Today you are a 'toy' and nothing more."

Cardin's mind could barely process what was happening now. Velvet just told him he was a toy and he was to massage her feet. What?! She couldn't be serious, right? He looked at the massive foot and toes presented before him and winced. She'd flatten him. He needed to get away, but all his attempts so far have been futile.

"W-what I-if I refuse?" he dared to ask.

"You don't have a choice!" Velvet said firmly.

Cardin gulped.

"Now bow and get to work."
152211.title: There's No Escpae!

choices: Velvet finds another use for Cardin
Russel, Dove, & Sky looking for Cardin
1522111.content:
Knowing there was nothing he could do at the moment, Cardin bowed his head and complied. This seemed to appease the giant rabbit faunus and she eagerly awaited for her bully to service her.

The orange-haired could feel his fear and nervousness rise to an all time high as he cautiously made his way closer to Velvet's giant digits. They were slightly taller than he was and the sight truly put into perspective how small he was.

"Please do hurry up Cardin, you wouldn't want me to get bored." Velvet lightly threatened.

Cardin got the message loud and clear. The giant toes of the vengeful huntress in training began to scrunch, signaling him to get a move on.

The leader of team CRDL did just that and carefully put hand to Velvet's big toe. Surprisingly enough her skin was silky smooth and ridiculously soft. The only thing that ruined the rather bizarre moment was the smell.

Velvet's foot had the distinct stench of sweat and coconut lotion. If she were still her old 5'6" self then the smell wouldn't have even been noticeable. But at her new stature then odor merely grew in strength.

Cardin hated it, but chose not to comment out of fear of being punished. Honestly, being in rabbit's presence now reminded him of the time he and his team got on professor Goodwitch's bad side.

Not wanting to make situation any worse, the average sized teen got to work massage the toe. Again, the skin was surprisingly soft against his own. That coconut lotion stuff must be something else.

Velvet on her part hummed in amusement. She could just barely feel Cardin's tiny hands against her toe. She was far too big for him to really do anything, but it was the dominance she held over him that mattered.

"This is pathetic." Velvet teased with mock annoyance. "I can barely feel your hands again my skin. Press harder before I decide to just crush you outright."

The reaction was instantaneous as her fellow academy student began to press harder. Surprisingly enough she actually began to feel it. Perhaps he just need a good threat to make him work harder? Why he hadn't earlier baffled her. Her did have muscles after all. Her was literally built like a brick-shithouse.

Meanwhile down below Cardin was massaging like his life depended on it. In a way it kind of did. He'd never given a massage before, let alone to girl the side of a small mountain.

He needed to press harder, squeeze harder. If she didn't feel him working hard then she'd know he was half-assing the job. And that meant nothing good for him. How could he have let himself be reduced to a mere foot servant?

His father would be so disappointed in him.

"Faster." Velvet ordered. She was actually starting to enjoy this.

"Fine." Cardin seethed under his breath and worked his hands fasters. Thank goodness he had enough speed to go along with his strength. It's what made him a good Beacon candidate. He never once thought that speed and strength would be used to massage a vengeful giant.

He began working his way around the toe and in between the big and second. As he did the smell grew stronger. It made him want to gag. It reminded him of the time Dove tried to cook for the team.

"Good god! Doesn't she know how to wash her foot!" Cardin said without thinking.

Uh... oh.

"I heard that, Cardin!" Velvet growled.

Cardin's eyes widened as he looked up to meet the angry giant's glare. Those chocolate brown eyes burned like an inferno that threatened to swallow him whole. How on earth had she... oh, right.

"Damn rabbit ears." he whispered.

Velvet was practically snarling now. This kind of disrespect would not stand.

15221113.content:
"Hey guys? Any of you seen Cardin around?" Russel asked.

"Nope." Dove answered as he flipped through his scroll.

"He said something, but I was only half listening." Sky admitted. They might've been friends but he wasn't Cardin's keeper. "What? He owe you money or something?"

"Nah. He just left this morning and didn't say where he was headed off to." Russel explained. It was strange, Cardin always told them where he was headed off too, and sometimes he even invited them to tag along.

"Now that you mention it. That is wired." Dove said as he looked away from his scroll. Currently the group of three where just lounging around in the school's courtyard. Normally they'd be in town or ribbing a few of the other students, but without their leader they just seemed a bit lost.

"Have you tried calling him?" Sky asked.

"I did, but it went tight to voice mail." Russel replied. The other two were starting to look a little worried now. "Maybe we should try to look for him. Just to make sure he's okay."

"Yeah." Dove agreed.

"Ditto." said Sky.

"Alright then!" Russel called. "Since Cardin's leader and I'm his partner that makes me the second in command, and right now our first order of business is to go find him and make sure everything's all good."

Sky rolled his eyes. "So where do we start oh fearless leader?"

"I have... no idea." Russel deflated.

"We could ask around to see if anyone's seen him?" Dove contributed.

Russel's eyes lit up. "That works."

"Just one problem. Half the school hates us." Sky reminded. "There's no way they'd help us."

Russel sighed. Sky had a point, they weren't the most popular considering their titles as bullies. "Well, we could always just search the campus from top to bottom."

"That'll take forever." Dove whined.

"Well we gotta do something!" Russel argued.

"Urgh! You're our leader right now, you decide." Sky groaned.

Russel pinched the bridge of his nose. What to do? what to do?
15221113.title: Where's Cardin?

152211133.content:
Before the remaining members of team CRDL could come to a consensus, a dark and foreboding aura began to hang over them. It was raw and ugly, almost as if a rabid beast was lying in wait to pounce.

"Do you guys feel that?" Russel asked nervously.

"Yeah, it kind of feels like someone's giving us the evil eye." Dove gulped.

"No shit?" Sky said with an obvious hint of fear in his voice.

The killing intent around them began to get thinker and hang even heavier. Who or whatever was watching them wanted to skin and fillet them alive, no question.

"Who do you think's watching us?" Dove questioned, his eyes wavering all around him.

"You don't think it's a Grimm do you?" Russel answered.

"Couldn't be. We're in Beacon behind walls and trained Huntsmen." Sky replied.

None of this made any sense. Where on Remnant was this killing intent coming from and who or what was aiming it at them. They hadn't managed to piss off anyone that bad, had they?

As if on que... "HEY!"

The group of three jumped as they all swiftly turned their heads to see an enraged looking girl they'd become all too familiar with since coming to Beacon. They couldn't see her eyes because of the shades, but they knew they were burning with white hot furry. The same furry that was carried by the two other males flanking her.

"It's team CVFY." Russel stated.

"Thanks for pointing that out captain obvious?" Sky said sarcastically.

Dove merely sighed. "Figures. If there was anyone here who hated our guts more than anyone else it's them."

"Where's the rabbit though." Dove thought. "Can we help you--"

"Cut the crap!" The girl in shades growled. "I'm only gonna ask this once and you better give me an answer! Where's Velvet!?"

Eh?

The other member's of team CVFY began to crack their knuckles. This wasn't looking good.

"W-we don't know." Russel answered honestly, though this apparently was the wrong answer as he found himself being brought down to team CVFY's leader's level by his collar.

Sky and Dove tried to intervene but found themselves locked in a stalemate by the other two... what were their names again, Fox and Yatsuhashi? Yeah that sounded about right. And the angry fashionista was Coco.

"Do you think I'm stupid!?" Coco snapped, gaining the attention of a few students passing by. It was no secret the two teams had a distain for each other and now it looked like things were finally about to blow up. "Velvet wouldn't just up and vanish! Something's up and want you three clowns to fess up... and while we're at it, where's your ringleader? Where's Cardin?"

The crowed was growing larger, things were really getting out of hand. Dove and Sky could make out the low murmurings, some wanting an inevitable brawl to break out and leave them in heap of all their past deeds.

"We really don't know." Dove tried. "We haven't seen your friend and we haven't seen Cardin either. He's missing too."

"And you expect us to believe you don't know where your leader went?" Yatsu responded with a large frown. "Your team doesn't have the best reputation, especially when it comes to the faunus."

Fox nodded.

"That's right, so spill!" Coco threatened.

Sky groaned in annoyance. "For the last time woman we don't know! We tried calling him but he wouldn't pick up! Russ saw him leave this morning and he's been gone ever since!"

"It's true." Russel confirmed, not wanting things to break down any further. "We were about to go looking for him before you showed up."

Coco tightened her grip on the first year. She couldn't tell if they were lying or not, but the fact that their leader was Cardin and that they went out of their way to bully her partner and everyone else did them no favors. Not to mention their little argument was drawing a crowd.

"Just listen to us will ya, we're telling the truth."

153131.content:
"What is this place?" Jaune asked as he and his partner raced after Ozpin. Throughout his brief stint in Beacon Academy he'd never seen a long corridor like this before. It was dimly lit and looked to be quite ancient in design.

"It's a type of vault." Pyrrha frowned, not bother to slow down.

"You've been here before?" Jaune asked. She didn't answer, she merely turned her head away. "Why would the school need to... hide?"

The blonde came to a stop as he and the others reached the end of the corridor. In front of them was a small room with machinery that honestly looked like it came straight out of one of his comic books.

"What?" he said in confusion. "Who--"

"Jaune?" Pyrrha called, her tone indicating worry. While was left baffled, she and the headmaster still had a job to do.

"Pyrrha, get to the pod." Ozpin ordered. He needed to make the power transfer now before all hope was lost. The enemy was here, above ground attacking his school, he had to make sure they didn't claim what they came here for.

With a reluctant nod, Pyrrha headed for the closed pod.

Ozpin then turned his attention back to the blonde leader of team JNPR. "Mr. Arc, if you'd like to help, you can stand guard here."

The young leader was still confused but this wasn't the time for questions. He would stand guard and protect his teammate from whatever was to come. This he swore.

"What do we do now?" Pyrrha asked as she watched the headmaster quickly type in a set of codes.

The man sighed. "Now? We do nothing." he finished typing, and the pod began to open. "You, Ms. Nikos, have a choice to make."

The redhead listened the older man's words and thought long and hard about the life changing choice presented in front of her. If she went through with this then her life would change forever. The life she had envisioned for herself before coming to Beacon would forever be shattered.

She looked towards the awaiting pod, it's cold steel and blue glowing welcoming her. Then she turned back towards her leader and teammate that stood guard faithfully for her. She wiped her eyes before any tears could fall. She knew what she had to do. She steeled her resolve and accepted the pod's cold embrace.

She laid back and let the door seal shut.

It was then that the room shook. Clearly the battle above was intensifying. Ozpin needed to speed the process along before it was too late. He began to type faster before addressing his waiting student, "Are you ready?"

She looked him square in the eyes, and nodded. It was now or never.

"I... I need to hear you say it."

"Yes." Pyrrha replied.

"Thank you, Ms. Nikos." he typed in a few more codes and another pod rose to life, inside a young woman who appeared to be gravely injured. She emitted a bright golden glow that flowed through her pod and up into the wires above. The golden light continued to move until it reached it's intended destination... Pyrrha's own pod.

The process had finally begun.

The foreign light began to surround the mistral champion and she let out a pained cry from the sudden invasion. Ozpin watched on with a sad expression while Jaune was a lot more vocal.

"Pyrrha!!!"

"Keep your eyes focused, Mr. Arc." Ozpin said without taking his off his student. Quickly Jaune turned back to the corridor and what he saw made his eyes widen. A women in red notching an arrow straight towards the other pod.

"We got trouble!" Jaune yelled, gaining the headmaster's attention. He too saw what was coming but was unfortunately not quick enough to stop what was coming.

The arrow flew towards the injured woman's pod... but before it could even reach it's target, Jaune raised his shield and blocked the incoming projectile.

The red woman clicked her tongue. Beacon's own resident weakling actually managed to blocked her shot. "How annoying." she whispered.

Then to the surprise of all, the lights went out, the room bathed in a faint glow of golden light. Everyone turned towards the pods and watched as the injured woman's glow flickered out.

Soon, Pyrrha's pod was the only one glowing...

At an abandoned laboratory complex, Team JNPR was on a scout mission to see if there was anything that in the area that would be worthy to report. So far, other than either trying to sneak around or taking out some random Grimm that were wandering near the area it was a fairly quiet mission. At the moment Nora was checking another area by herself while humming a tune along the way.

Eventually, she arrived at a very open room filled with different slightly dust covered computers and some exposed wires. Overall it was surprisingly intact as Nora wandered around the area before randomly flipped a switch not realizing that there was some power left causing the room to light up.

And in the center of the room was a podium with a massive machine that honestly looked like a giant ray gun with multiple wires and pipes connected into it.

Nora then walked up to the podium and looked at the machine in wonder, "What the heck is that thing?"

But as she stares at the "Ray Gun" a portion of the ceiling gave way and managed to hit some controls that connected to the machine causing some steam and other sounds to emit from it.

Before Nora could react, the machine paints a small red laser light into her chest momentarily confusing her before it suddenly lets out an electric beam hitting her in the chest.

Normally, due to Nora's Semblance, she could've easily absorbed the electric energy and use it to enhance her strength. But this time though, the machine somehow caused Nora to shake uncontrollably as the energy coursed into her body before the old machine overloaded and explodes causing Nora to be thrown onto her back and lose her weapon, Magnhild.

Dazed, Nora slowly sat back up while not noticing her body was covered in electrical arcs from the beam. Unknown to her though, the machine had made an unexpected change to her Semblance where instead of enhancing her strength, it instead spread throughout her body causing Nora to gain an increase to her height initially but also absorb her now malfunctioning Scroll's energy giving Nora another two more inches resulting in her height going from originally 5'1" to now 5'3".

By the time she opened her eyes, the arcs had disappeared and only tiny remnant lights from the beam fell from her body.

"Oooh! Sparkly!"

Less than a few seconds later, the rest of her concerned Team burst into the room after hearing the explosion and immediately bombarded Nora with questions before she simply waved them off and answered to reassure them, "Relax~! It was just some electric beam thingy. My Semblance can absorb an electric current and make me stronger so it's nothing it can't handle."

As J(N)PR glance at what remained of the machine and back at her, they all collectively sighed before Jaune said, "...Alright, we get it but try to be more careful the next time we go out on a mission. Okay, Nora?"

Nora simply grinned as she gives a mock salute, "Aye aye fearless leader!"

The rest of her Team chuckled (a small smile and shaking his head in Ren's case) while Nora retrieved her weapon before Pyrrha commented that it looked like the room they are in was the only one left, meaning that they had likely finished exploring everything in the abandoned complex and that they should return to Beacon.

15522222222222222222222111.content:
Weiss adored her sister Winter, throughout her life she had been her example. Her role model, her ideal. A brave, strong, disciplined, sophisticated woman. She had slipped away from the bonds of their father, and managed to forge her own path with the Atlesian military, regardless of their father's wishes.

Winter was all Weiss wanted to be, so whenever Winter had free time the heiress would take every opportunity to spend it with her. That included training, her sister was responsible for building the foundations of what would become her fighting style, teaching her in the craft of their family's hereditary semblance.

Weiss loved her sister dearly, ever thankful for all she had done for her.

"Don't you dare stop now you daintly little girl!"

...That is not to say that sometimes her sister didn't make it easy sometimes.

The heiress watched as the ground grew close and furthered away, only to grow close once again. Breathing with effort as she pushed her arms up and down. Weiss sincerely hated physical training, but she knew it was vital for any Huntsman.

Weiss was sure Winter was currently channeling all that experience from the training she recieved at the military academy at Atlas. The same type drill Sergeants subjugated the students to. Winter watched her with a heavy critical gaze, donning a military white coat, arms crossed behind her back, as Weiss continued with the pushups.

The heiress was currently wearing not her usual white dress, but white yoga pants along with a white sports braw, her body sweat until there was a small puddle under her face, her arms were starting to protest in agony. She had lost count how many she had done so far, well, she did not count at all to begin with. Winter had not set a required number of pushups, she had just ordered her to do them until she said it was enough.

Thankfully, Winter finally decided to be merciful. "That's enough, take five"

Weiss collapsed on the ground, gasping for breath. To merely remain still for a moment was a blessing after this.

Winter harrumphed in disappointment. "Your physical fitness leaves much to be desired, Weiss"

The heiress managed to find the strength to sit down. "I'm not a physical fighter like Yang... I'm built for agility and casting"

"Both which means nothing if your body can't handle the pressure of combat" Her sister repriminded. "You need to build up your stamina and body strength, develop those paltry muscles of yours"

Weiss didn't dare roll her eyes, but she definitely wanted too. "I'm not sure I want muscles"

"Whether you want them or not is irrelevant. You need to be in better shape"

"I don't think I'm the type to build that type of body anyway"

Winter's eyes narrowed, making Weiss wince, thinking she had said something wrong. "Not the type huh? Then by that logic neither should I be"

Before Weiss' eyes, Winter began removing the upper parts of her attire. Her younger sister could see a black sports bra as she unbotted the coat.

It soom came off, leaving Weiss gawking.
15522222222222222222222111.title: Muscle growth

155222222222222222222221112.content:
Weiss was a person who prided herself in possessing a wide range of vocabulary and elegant choice in vernacular. But at the sight of her sister's body there was only one word that came to mind (one that Yang herself would use no doubt)

Winter was ripped

With her military coat off, and left in a simple black sports bra that hung tight around her chest, along with strentched yoga pants, Winter's oustandingly developed body was in full display.

Her forarms were corded and thick, leading the way to bulging inches of unflexed biceps and protounding triceps. Her deltoids were large balls of flesh split into the different muscle groups in a noticeable way. Her torso managed to blend perfectly a curved womanly figure while possessing a wide musculature, Six abdominal muscles of amazing definition, and several visible muscle groups around them, protected her stomach like a steadfast shield. Where her abdomen ended and her upper body started, her lats flared somewhat with her arms relaxed at the side, her prodigious chest (something which Weiss has always been secretely jealous of) was supported by two thick pecturals, corded muscles with shredded definition in the middle.Though her legs remained hidden, the yoga pants did little to conceal their size. Wide thighs and diamond carved calves filled out the fabric and pushed it to its limits, her rear standing out nicely due to the iron-like glutes.

Winter took a deep breath, and brought her fists closed to her hips. Her lats spreading as her chest heaved, her abs tightening as she flexed her upper body. Her biceps bulged a few inches foward, the skin tightened to show off greater definition.

"Or is it that you see a woman with this physique to be an embarrasment? Foolish notions of society, my body has nothing to do with appereances, I honed my muscles to serve me better on the field"

You look so... so strong" Those were the only words that came to mind, she didn't know what to say. Compliment her sister on her figure? Say how amazing she looked like that?

The world of remnant is caught in the throes of a global pandemic caused by the outbreak of a virus called T-010, also known as "Titan". Anyone who is infected by it is mutated into massive, hulking, hyper aggressive and lustful behemoths devoid of rational thought and any scruples that they may have once driven only by their nigh insatiable hunger for sex and violence. 155222222222222222222222222222222.content:
In an alternate universe Millennia before the brother gods passed their judgment, a sorcerer of legendary might and knowledge foresaw the calamity that would befall
mankind and spent his life searching for a way to forestall it or at least find a way for
humanity to persist.
Through his mastery of the different aspects of the human soul, he had acquired a form of
immortality and spent countless life times experimenting with magic of all kinds and exploring the limits of reality.
Some time during the interim, he had built up a massive following who helped him in his quest for survival.
Together this cabal learned how to bend reality in ways that conventional magic couldn't hope to match, created artificial planes, and even travelled to other worlds!
Eventually they even discovered how to manifest the spark of divinity itself.
From that point a plan had been concocted.
By claiming chunks of the spirit realms, tapping into planes of boundless high energy, and combining them with their artificial pocket dimensions, they had created both a safe haven for Humanity's souls and the medium for its ascension.
After crafting an inconceivable spell that would bind the entire Human races souls to this ritual, it was simply a matter of waiting.
The ages passed and empires rose and fell.
During that time the cabal had perfected their craft and the tools of their salvation, adding new dimensions and pushing them beyond all previously accepted limits.
Eventually, the day of prophecy had arrived and the gods unleashed their wrath upon the world.
Fortunately the cabal was well prepared.
When the younger brother unleashed his squall of annihilation, instead of being consigned to oblivion
all the souls of every living human, save for two, were transported to the great sorcerer’s sanctuary
The planes of “Asirius”.

Once there the Cabal, who had long since imbibed the essence of divinity, would preform a ritual where
the souls of the first generation of humanity would be imbued with the same spark and they would wait
for a time were they could return to the earthly plane within the safety of their make shift Heavens.
Eons would pass before they had sensed the spark of life returned to their home world.
They would gaze down upon their former home to see that it had become a wild and savage place where the beasts of the younger brother wandered the earth unrestrained.
The now named “Asirians" would also come to know that a second iteration of humanity had somehow come into existence and now lived on the world much like they used to, much to their surprise.
It quickly became apparent that the second gen humans lacked the innate gifts of the gods and were virtually helpless against the black beasts.
The Asirians felt pity for the “second born" as they had come to call them, abandoned by the gods and left to fend for themselves.
A feeling that they were all too familiar with.
A sense of obligation and duty swelled within them, they would insure that these people would not suffer the same fate that did.
And so the decision was made.
A vast portion of the Asirians would descend down to Remnant and aid the second born directly while the rest would remain in Asirius and offer more spiritual and cosmic assistance.
When the Asirians came down from on high they gave mankind two gifts.
The first gift was the power of magic so that they could protect themselves and fuel their ambitions.
For the second gift the Asirians had bound melded mankind's souls with their own so that they may never fear being alone.
Armed with the power of magic and backed by the power of the Asirians/first born, the tribes of humanity and Faunus drove back the beasts now called “Grimm” and created civilization.
Ever since that fateful day mankind has known prosperity the likes of which it could have only dreamed of before.
However, powerful forces of darkness and evil lurk in the shadows of this world waiting and watching, biding their time for the right moment to strike.
Fortunately there are also plenty of heroes to face them.
155222222222222222222222222222222.title: Remnant: a world reborn
